            # Use FixtureResolver in your tests to simulate the presence of files on the
        
      5. 
      
        
    5. 
          
          
            # file system. This is used internally by Rails' own test suite, and is
        
      6. 
      
        
    6.

      7. 
      
        
    7.

            class FixtureResolver < PathResolver
        
      9.

          1
          
              attr_reader :hash

              def initialize(hash = {}, pattern=nil)

              def query(path, exts, formats, _)
        
      23. 
      
        
    23. 
          
          
                query = ""
        
      24. 
      
        
    24. 
          
          
                EXTENSIONS.each_key do |ext|
        
      25. 
      
        
    25. 
          
          
                  query << '(' << exts[ext].map {|e| e && Regexp.escape(".#{e}") }.join('|') << '|)'
        
      26. 
      
        
    26. 
          
          
                end
        
      27. 
      
        
    27. 
          
          
                query = /^(#{Regexp.escape(path)})#{query}$/
        
      28. 
      
        
    28. 
          
          
          
        
      29. 
      
        
    29. 
          
          
                templates = []
        
      30. 
      
        
    30. 
          
          
                @hash.each do |_path, array|
        
      31. 
      
        
    31. 
          
          
                  source, updated_at = array
        
      32. 
      
        
    32. 
          
          
                  next unless _path =~ query
        
      33. 
      
        
    33. 
          
          
                  handler, format, variant = extract_handler_and_format_and_variant(_path, formats)
        
      34. 
      
        
    34. 
          
          
                  templates << Template.new(source, _path, handler,
        
      35. 
      
        
    35. 
          
          
                    :virtual_path => path.virtual,
        
      36. 
      
        
    36. 
          
          
                    :format => format,
        
      37. 
      
        
    37. 
          
          
                    :variant => variant,
        
      38. 
      
        
    38. 
          
          
                    :updated_at => updated_at
        
      39. 
      
        
    39. 
          
          
                  )
        
      40. 
      
        
    40. 
          
          
                end
        
      41. 
      
        
    41. 
          
          
          
        
      42. 
      
        
    42. 
          
          
                templates.sort_by {|t| -t.identifier.match(/^#{query}$/).captures.reject(&:blank?).size }
        
      43. 
      
        
    43. 
          
          
              end
        
      44. 
      
        
    44. 
          
          
            end
        
      45.

          1
          
            class NullResolver < PathResolver
        
      47. 
      
        
    47. 
          1
          
              def query(path, exts, formats, _)
        
      48. 
      
        
    48. 
          
          
                handler, format, variant = extract_handler_and_format_and_variant(path, formats)
        
      49. 
      
        
    49. 
          
          
                [ActionView::Template.new("Template generated by Null Resolver", path.virtual, handler, :virtual_path => path.virtual, :format => format, :variant => variant)]
        
      50. 
      
        
    50. 
          
          
              end

            end

            # Raised when an exception is raised during job arguments deserialization.
        
      5.

            #
        
      6.

            # Wraps the original exception raised as +cause+.
        
      7.

          1
          
            class DeserializationError < StandardError
        
      8. 
      
        
    8. 
          1
          
              def initialize(e = nil) #:nodoc:
        
      9. 
      
        
    9. 
          
          
                if e
        
      10. 
      
        
    10. 
          
          
                  ActiveSupport::Deprecation.warn("Passing #original_exception is deprecated and has no effect. " \
        
      11. 
      
        
    11. 
          
          
                                                  "Exceptions will automatically capture the original exception.", caller)
        
      12. 
      
        
    12. 
          
          
                end
        
      13. 
      
        
    13. 
          
          
          
        
      14. 
      
        
    14. 
          
          
                super("Error while trying to deserialize arguments: #{$!.message}")
        
      15. 
      
        
    15. 
          
          
                set_backtrace $!.backtrace
        
      16. 
      
        
    16. 
          
          
              end
        
      17. 
      
        
    17. 
          
          
          
        
      18. 
      
        
    18. 
          
          
              # The original exception that was raised during deserialization of job
        
      19. 
      
        
    19. 
          
          
              # arguments.
        
      20. 
      
        
    20. 
          1
          
              def original_exception
        
      21. 
      
        
    21. 
          
          
                ActiveSupport::Deprecation.warn("#original_exception is deprecated. Use #cause instead.", caller)
        
      22. 
      
        
    22. 
          
          
                cause
        
      23. 
      
        
    23. 
          
          
              end
        
      24. 
      
        
    24. 
          
          
            end
        
      25. 
      
        
    25. 
          
          
          
        
      26. 
      
        
    26. 
          
          
            # Raised when an unsupported argument type is set as a job argument. We
        
      27. 
      
        
    27. 
          
          
            # currently support NilClass, Integer, Fixnum, Float, String, TrueClass, FalseClass,
        
      28. 
      
        
    28. 
          
          
            # Bignum, BigDecimal, and objects that can be represented as GlobalIDs (ex: Active Record).
        
      29. 
      
        
    29. 
          
          
            # Raised if you set the key for a Hash something else than a string or
        
      30. 
      
        
    30. 
          
          
            # a symbol. Also raised when trying to serialize an object which can't be
        
      31. 
      
        
    31. 
          
          
            # identified with a Global ID - such as an unpersisted Active Record model.
        
      32. 
      
        
    32. 
          1
          
            class SerializationError < ArgumentError; end
        
      33. 
      
        
    33. 
          
          
          
        
      34. 
      
        
    34. 
          1
          
            module Arguments
        
      35. 
      
        
    35. 
          1
          
              extend self
        
      36. 
      
        
    36. 
          
          
              # :nodoc:
        
      37. 
      
        
    37. 
          
          
              # Calls #uniq since Integer, Fixnum, and Bignum are all the same class on Ruby 2.4+
        
      38. 
      
        
    38. 
          1
          
              TYPE_WHITELIST = [ NilClass, String, Integer, Fixnum, Bignum, Float, BigDecimal, TrueClass, FalseClass ].uniq
        
      39. 
      
        
    39. 
          
          
          
        
      40. 
      
        
    40. 
          
          
              # Serializes a set of arguments. Whitelisted types are returned
        
      41. 
      
        
    41. 
          
          
              # as-is. Arrays/Hashes are serialized element by element.
        
      42. 
      
        
    42. 
          
          
              # All other types are serialized using GlobalID.
        
      43. 
      
        
    43. 
          1
          
              def serialize(arguments)
        
      44. 
      
        
    44. 
          
          
                arguments.map { |argument| serialize_argument(argument) }
        
      45. 
      
        
    45. 
          
          
              end
        
      46. 
      
        
    46. 
          
          
          
        
      47. 
      
        
    47. 
          
          
              # Deserializes a set of arguments. Whitelisted types are returned
        
      48. 
      
        
    48. 
          
          
              # as-is. Arrays/Hashes are deserialized element by element.
        
      49. 
      
        
    49. 
          
          
              # All other types are deserialized using GlobalID.
        
      50. 
      
        
    50. 
          1
          
              def deserialize(arguments)
        
      51. 
      
        
    51. 
          
          
                arguments.map { |argument| deserialize_argument(argument) }
        
      52. 
      
        
    52. 
          
          
              rescue
        
      53. 
      
        
    53. 
          
          
                raise DeserializationError
        
      54. 
      
        
    54. 
          
          
              end
        
      55. 
      
        
    55. 
          
          
          
        
      56. 
      
        
    56. 
          1
          
              private
        
      57. 
      
        
    57. 
          
          
                # :nodoc:
        
      58. 
      
        
    58. 
          1
          
                GLOBALID_KEY = '_aj_globalid'.freeze
        
      59. 
      
        
    59. 
          
          
                # :nodoc:
        
      60. 
      
        
    60. 
          1
          
                SYMBOL_KEYS_KEY = '_aj_symbol_keys'.freeze
        
      61. 
      
        
    61. 
          
          
                # :nodoc:
        
      62. 
      
        
    62. 
          1
          
                WITH_INDIFFERENT_ACCESS_KEY = '_aj_hash_with_indifferent_access'.freeze
        
      63. 
      
        
    63. 
          1
          
                private_constant :GLOBALID_KEY, :SYMBOL_KEYS_KEY, :WITH_INDIFFERENT_ACCESS_KEY
        
      64. 
      
        
    64. 
          
          
          
        
      65. 
      
        
    65. 
          1
          
                def serialize_argument(argument)
        
      66. 
      
        
    66. 
          
          
                  case argument
        
      67. 
      
        
    67. 
          
          
                  when *TYPE_WHITELIST
        
      68. 
      
        
    68. 
          
          
                    argument
        
      69. 
      
        
    69. 
          
          
                  when GlobalID::Identification
        
      70. 
      
        
    70. 
          
          
                    convert_to_global_id_hash(argument)
        
      71. 
      
        
    71. 
          
          
                  when Array
        
      72. 
      
        
    72. 
          
          
                    argument.map { |arg| serialize_argument(arg) }
        
      73. 
      
        
    73. 
          
          
                  when ActiveSupport::HashWithIndifferentAccess
        
      74. 
      
        
    74. 
          
          
                    result = serialize_hash(argument)
        
      75. 
      
        
    75. 
          
          
                    result[WITH_INDIFFERENT_ACCESS_KEY] = serialize_argument(true)
        
      76. 
      
        
    76. 
          
          
                    result
        
      77. 
      
        
    77. 
          
          
                  when Hash
        
      78. 
      
        
    78. 
          
          
                    symbol_keys = argument.each_key.grep(Symbol).map(&:to_s)
        
      79. 
      
        
    79. 
          
          
                    result = serialize_hash(argument)
        
      80. 
      
        
    80. 
          
          
                    result[SYMBOL_KEYS_KEY] = symbol_keys
        
      81. 
      
        
    81. 
          
          
                    result
        
      82. 
      
        
    82. 
          
          
                  else
        
      83. 
      
        
    83. 
          
          
                    raise SerializationError.new("Unsupported argument type: #{argument.class.name}")
        
      84. 
      
        
    84. 
          
          
                  end
        
      85. 
      
        
    85. 
          
          
                end
        
      86. 
      
        
    86. 
          
          
          
        
      87. 
      
        
    87. 
          1
          
                def deserialize_argument(argument)
        
      88. 
      
        
    88. 
          
          
                  case argument
        
      89. 
      
        
    89. 
          
          
                  when String
        
      90. 
      
        
    90. 
          
          
                    GlobalID::Locator.locate(argument) || argument
        
      91. 
      
        
    91. 
          
          
                  when *TYPE_WHITELIST
        
      92. 
      
        
    92. 
          
          
                    argument
        
      93. 
      
        
    93. 
          
          
                  when Array
        
      94. 
      
        
    94. 
          
          
                    argument.map { |arg| deserialize_argument(arg) }
        
      95. 
      
        
    95. 
          
          
                  when Hash
        
      96. 
      
        
    96. 
          
          
                    if serialized_global_id?(argument)
        
      97. 
      
        
    97. 
          
          
                      deserialize_global_id argument
        
      98. 
      
        
    98. 
          
          
                    else
        
      99. 
      
        
    99. 
          
          
                      deserialize_hash(argument)
        
      100. 
      
        
    100. 
          
          
                    end
        
      101. 
      
        
    101. 
          
          
                  else
        
      102. 
      
        
    102. 
          
          
                    raise ArgumentError, "Can only deserialize primitive arguments: #{argument.inspect}"
        
      103. 
      
        
    103. 
          
          
                  end
        
      104. 
      
        
    104. 
          
          
                end
        
      105. 
      
        
    105. 
          
          
          
        
      106. 
      
        
    106. 
          1
          
                def serialized_global_id?(hash)
        
      107. 
      
        
    107. 
          
          
                  hash.size == 1 and hash.include?(GLOBALID_KEY)
        
      108. 
      
        
    108. 
          
          
                end
        
      109. 
      
        
    109. 
          
          
          
        
      110. 
      
        
    110. 
          1
          
                def deserialize_global_id(hash)
        
      111. 
      
        
    111. 
          
          
                  GlobalID::Locator.locate hash[GLOBALID_KEY]
        
      112. 
      
        
    112. 
          
          
                end
        
      113. 
      
        
    113. 
          
          
          
        
      114. 
      
        
    114. 
          1
          
                def serialize_hash(argument)
        
      115. 
      
        
    115. 
          
          
                  argument.each_with_object({}) do |(key, value), hash|
        
      116. 
      
        
    116. 
          
          
                    hash[serialize_hash_key(key)] = serialize_argument(value)
        
      117. 
      
        
    117. 
          
          
                  end
        
      118. 
      
        
    118. 
          
          
                end
        
      119. 
      
        
    119. 
          
          
          
        
      120. 
      
        
    120. 
          1
          
                def deserialize_hash(serialized_hash)
        
      121. 
      
        
    121. 
          
          
                  result = serialized_hash.transform_values { |v| deserialize_argument(v) }
        
      122. 
      
        
    122. 
          
          
                  if result.delete(WITH_INDIFFERENT_ACCESS_KEY)
        
      123. 
      
        
    123. 
          
          
                    result = result.with_indifferent_access
        
      124. 
      
        
    124. 
          
          
                  elsif symbol_keys = result.delete(SYMBOL_KEYS_KEY)
        
      125. 
      
        
    125. 
          
          
                    result = transform_symbol_keys(result, symbol_keys)
        
      126. 
      
        
    126. 
          
          
                  end
        
      127. 
      
        
    127. 
          
          
                  result
        
      128. 
      
        
    128. 
          
          
                end
        
      129. 
      
        
    129. 
          
          
          
        
      130. 
      
        
    130. 
          
          
                # :nodoc:
        
      131. 
      
        
    131. 
          1
          
                RESERVED_KEYS = [
        
      132. 
      
        
    132. 
          
          
                  GLOBALID_KEY, GLOBALID_KEY.to_sym,
        
      133. 
      
        
    133. 
          
          
                  SYMBOL_KEYS_KEY, SYMBOL_KEYS_KEY.to_sym,
        
      134. 
      
        
    134. 
          
          
                  WITH_INDIFFERENT_ACCESS_KEY, WITH_INDIFFERENT_ACCESS_KEY.to_sym,
        
      135. 
      
        
    135. 
          
          
                ]
        
      136. 
      
        
    136. 
          1
          
                private_constant :RESERVED_KEYS
        
      137. 
      
        
    137. 
          
          
          
        
      138. 
      
        
    138. 
          1
          
                def serialize_hash_key(key)
        
      139. 
      
        
    139. 
          
          
                  case key
        
      140. 
      
        
    140. 
          
          
                  when *RESERVED_KEYS
        
      141. 
      
        
    141. 
          
          
                    raise SerializationError.new("Can't serialize a Hash with reserved key #{key.inspect}")
        
      142. 
      
        
    142. 
          
          
                  when String, Symbol
        
      143. 
      
        
    143. 
          
          
                    key.to_s
        
      144. 
      
        
    144. 
          
          
                  else
        
      145. 
      
        
    145. 
          
          
                    raise SerializationError.new("Only string and symbol hash keys may be serialized as job arguments, but #{key.inspect} is a #{key.class}")
        
      146. 
      
        
    146. 
          
          
                  end
        
      147. 
      
        
    147. 
          
          
                end
        
      148. 
      
        
    148. 
          
          
          
        
      149. 
      
        
    149. 
          1
          
                def transform_symbol_keys(hash, symbol_keys)
        
      150. 
      
        
    150. 
          
          
                  hash.transform_keys do |key|
        
      151. 
      
        
    151. 
          
          
                    if symbol_keys.include?(key)
        
      152. 
      
        
    152. 
          
          
                      key.to_sym
        
      153. 
      
        
    153. 
          
          
                    else
        
      154. 
      
        
    154. 
          
          
                      key
        
      155. 
      
        
    155. 
          
          
                    end
        
      156. 
      
        
    156. 
          
          
                  end
        
      157. 
      
        
    157. 
          
          
                end
        
      158. 
      
        
    158. 
          
          
          
        
      159. 
      
        
    159. 
          1
          
                def convert_to_global_id_hash(argument)
        
      160. 
      
        
    160. 
          
          
                  { GLOBALID_KEY => argument.to_global_id.to_s }
        
      161. 
      
        
    161. 
          
          
                rescue URI::GID::MissingModelIdError
        
      162. 
      
        
    162. 
          
          
                  raise SerializationError, "Unable to serialize #{argument.class} " \
        
      163. 
      
        
    163. 
          
          
                    "without an id. (Maybe you forgot to call save?)"
        
      164. 
      
        
    164. 
          
          
                end
        
      165. 
      
        
    165. 
          
          
            end
        
      166. 
      
        
    166. 
          
          
          end
        
      167.

    vendor/cache/ruby/2.3.0/gems/activejob-5.0.0.1/lib/active_job/base.rb

          1
          
          module ActiveJob #:nodoc:
        
      12. 
      
        
    12. 
          
          
            # = Active Job
        
      13. 
      
        
    13. 
          
          
            #
        
      14. 
      
        
    14. 
          
          
            # Active Job objects can be configured to work with different backend
        
      15. 
      
        
    15. 
          
          
            # queuing frameworks. To specify a queue adapter to use:
        
      16. 
      
        
    16. 
          
          
            #
        
      17. 
      
        
    17. 
          
          
            #   ActiveJob::Base.queue_adapter = :inline
        
      18. 
      
        
    18. 
          
          
            #
        
      19. 
      
        
    19. 
          
          
            # A list of supported adapters can be found in QueueAdapters.
        
      20. 
      
        
    20. 
          
          
            #
        
      21. 
      
        
    21. 
          
          
            # Active Job objects can be defined by creating a class that inherits
        
      22. 
      
        
    22. 
          
          
            # from the ActiveJob::Base class. The only necessary method to
        
      23. 
      
        
    23. 
          
          
            # implement is the "perform" method.
        
      24. 
      
        
    24. 
          
          
            #
        
      25. 
      
        
    25. 
          
          
            # To define an Active Job object:
        
      26. 
      
        
    26. 
          
          
            #
        
      27. 
      
        
    27. 
          
          
            #   class ProcessPhotoJob < ActiveJob::Base
        
      28. 
      
        
    28. 
          
          
            #     def perform(photo)
        
      29. 
      
        
    29. 
          
          
            #       photo.watermark!('Rails')
        
      30. 
      
        
    30. 
          
          
            #       photo.rotate!(90.degrees)
        
      31. 
      
        
    31. 
          
          
            #       photo.resize_to_fit!(300, 300)
        
      32. 
      
        
    32. 
          
          
            #       photo.upload!
        
      33. 
      
        
    33. 
          
          
            #     end
        
      34. 
      
        
    34. 
          
          
            #   end
        
      35. 
      
        
    35. 
          
          
            #
        
      36. 
      
        
    36. 
          
          
            # Records that are passed in are serialized/deserialized using Global
        
      37. 
      
        
    37. 
          
          
            # ID. More information can be found in Arguments.
        
      38. 
      
        
    38. 
          
          
            #
        
      39. 
      
        
    39. 
          
          
            # To enqueue a job to be performed as soon as the queueing system is free:
        
      40. 
      
        
    40. 
          
          
            #
        
      41. 
      
        
    41. 
          
          
            #   ProcessPhotoJob.perform_later(photo)
        
      42. 
      
        
    42. 
          
          
            #
        
      43. 
      
        
    43. 
          
          
            # To enqueue a job to be processed at some point in the future:
        
      44. 
      
        
    44. 
          
          
            #
        
      45. 
      
        
    45. 
          
          
            #   ProcessPhotoJob.set(wait_until: Date.tomorrow.noon).perform_later(photo)
        
      46. 
      
        
    46. 
          
          
            #
        
      47. 
      
        
    47. 
          
          
            # More information can be found in ActiveJob::Core::ClassMethods#set
        
      48. 
      
        
    48. 
          
          
            #
        
      49. 
      
        
    49. 
          
          
            # A job can also be processed immediately without sending to the queue:
        
      50. 
      
        
    50. 
          
          
            #
        
      51. 
      
        
    51. 
          
          
            #  ProcessPhotoJob.perform_now(photo)
        
      52. 
      
        
    52. 
          
          
            #
        
      53. 
      
        
    53. 
          
          
            # == Exceptions
        
      54. 
      
        
    54. 
          
          
            #

      56.

            # * SerializationError - Error class for serialization errors.
        
      57.

          1

          require 'active_support/callbacks'
        
      2. 
      
        
    2. 
          
          
          
        
      3. 
      
        
    3. 
          1
          
          module ActiveJob
        
      4. 
      
        
    4. 
          
          
            # = Active Job Callbacks
        
      5. 
      
        
    5. 
          
          
            #
        
      6. 
      
        
    6. 
          
          
            # Active Job provides hooks during the life cycle of a job. Callbacks allow you
        
      7. 
      
        
    7. 
          
          
            # to trigger logic during the life cycle of a job. Available callbacks are:
        
      8. 
      
        
    8. 
          
          
            #
        
      9. 
      
        
    9. 
          
          
            # * <tt>before_enqueue</tt>
        
      10. 
      
        
    10. 
          
          
            # * <tt>around_enqueue</tt>
        
      11. 
      
        
    11. 
          
          
            # * <tt>after_enqueue</tt>
        
      12. 
      
        
    12. 
          
          
            # * <tt>before_perform</tt>
        
      13. 
      
        
    13. 
          
          
            # * <tt>around_perform</tt>
        
      14. 
      
        
    14. 
          
          
            # * <tt>after_perform</tt>
        
      15. 
      
        
    15. 
          
          
            #
        
      16. 
      
        
    16. 
          1
          
            module Callbacks

          1
          
              extend  ActiveSupport::Concern
        
      18. 
      
        
    18. 
          1
          
              include ActiveSupport::Callbacks

              class << self

              end

              # These methods will be included into any Active Job object, adding
        
      31. 
      
        
    31. 
          
          
              # callbacks for +perform+ and +enqueue+ methods.
        
      32.

          1
          
              module ClassMethods
        
      33. 
      
        
    33. 
          
          
                # Defines a callback that will get called right before the
        
      34. 
      
        
    34. 
          
          
                # job's perform method is executed.
        
      35. 
      
        
    35. 
          
          
                #
        
      36. 
      
        
    36. 
          
          
                #   class VideoProcessJob < ActiveJob::Base
        
      37. 
      
        
    37. 
          
          
                #     queue_as :default
        
      38. 
      
        
    38. 
          
          
                #
        
      39. 
      
        
    39. 
          
          
                #     before_perform do |job|
        
      40. 
      
        
    40. 
          
          
                #       UserMailer.notify_video_started_processing(job.arguments.first)
        
      41. 
      
        
    41. 
          
          
                #     end
        
      42. 
      
        
    42. 
          
          
                #
        
      43. 
      
        
    43. 
          
          
                #     def perform(video_id)
        
      44. 
      
        
    44. 
          
          
                #       Video.find(video_id).process
        
      45. 
      
        
    45. 
          
          
                #     end
        
      46. 
      
        
    46. 
          
          
                #   end
        
      47. 
      
        
    47. 
          
          
                #
        
      48. 
      
        
    48. 
          1
          
                def before_perform(*filters, &blk)
        
      49. 
      
        
    49. 
          
          
                  set_callback(:perform, :before, *filters, &blk)
        
      50. 
      
        
    50. 
          
          
                end
        
      51. 
      
        
    51. 
          
          
          
        
      52. 
      
        
    52. 
          
          
                # Defines a callback that will get called right after the
        
      53. 
      
        
    53. 
          
          
                # job's perform method has finished.
        
      54. 
      
        
    54. 
          
          
                #
        
      55. 
      
        
    55. 
          
          
                #   class VideoProcessJob < ActiveJob::Base
        
      56. 
      
        
    56. 
          
          
                #     queue_as :default
        
      57.

    41. 
          
          
                # Creates a job preconfigured with the given options. You can call
        
      42. 
      
        
    42. 
          
          
                # perform_later with the job arguments to enqueue the job with the
        
      43. 
      
        
    43. 
          
          
                # preconfigured options
        
      44. 
      
        
    44. 
          
          
                #
        
      45. 
      
        
    45. 
          
          
                # ==== Options
        
      46. 
      
        
    46. 
          
          
                # * <tt>:wait</tt> - Enqueues the job with the specified delay
        
      47. 
      
        
    47. 
          
          
                # * <tt>:wait_until</tt> - Enqueues the job at the time specified
        
      48. 
      
        
    48. 
          
          
                # * <tt>:queue</tt> - Enqueues the job on the specified queue
        
      49. 
      
        
    49. 
          
          
                # * <tt>:priority</tt> - Enqueues the job with the specified priority
        
      50. 
      
        
    50. 
          
          
                #
        
      51. 
      
        
    51. 
          
          
                # ==== Examples
        
      52. 
      
        
    52. 
          
          
                #
        
      53. 
      
        
    53. 
          
          
                #    VideoJob.set(queue: :some_queue).perform_later(Video.last)
        
      54. 
      
        
    54. 
          
          
                #    VideoJob.set(wait: 5.minutes).perform_later(Video.last)
        
      55. 
      
        
    55. 
          
          
                #    VideoJob.set(wait_until: Time.now.tomorrow).perform_later(Video.last)
        
      56. 
      
        
    56. 
          
          
                #    VideoJob.set(queue: :some_queue, wait: 5.minutes).perform_later(Video.last)
        
      57. 
      
        
    57. 
          
          
                #    VideoJob.set(queue: :some_queue, wait_until: Time.now.tomorrow).perform_later(Video.last)
        
      58. 
      
        
    58. 
          
          
                #    VideoJob.set(queue: :some_queue, wait: 5.minutes, priority: 10).perform_later(Video.last)
        
      59. 
      
        
    59. 
          1

                def deserialize_arguments_if_needed
        
      116.

                  if defined?(@serialized_arguments) && @serialized_arguments.present?

          require 'active_job/arguments'
        
      2. 
      
        
    2. 
          
          
          
        
      3. 
      
        
    3. 
          1
          
          module ActiveJob
        
      4. 
      
        
    4. 
          
          
            # Provides behavior for enqueuing and retrying jobs.
        
      5. 
      
        
    5. 
          1
          
            module Enqueuing
        
      6. 
      
        
    6. 
          1
          
              extend ActiveSupport::Concern
        
      7. 
      
        
    7. 
          
          
          
        
      8. 
      
        
    8. 
          
          
              # Includes the +perform_later+ method for job initialization.
        
      9. 
      
        
    9. 
          1
          
              module ClassMethods
        
      10. 
      
        
    10. 
          
          
                # Push a job onto the queue. The arguments must be legal JSON types
        
      11. 
      
        
    11. 
          
          
                # (string, int, float, nil, true, false, hash or array) or
        
      12. 
      
        
    12. 
          
          
                # GlobalID::Identification instances. Arbitrary Ruby objects
        
      13. 
      
        
    13. 
          
          
                # are not supported.
        
      14. 
      
        
    14. 
          
          
                #
        
      15. 
      
        
    15. 
          
          
                # Returns an instance of the job class queued with arguments available in
        
      16. 
      
        
    16. 
          
          
                # Job#arguments.
        
      17. 
      
        
    17. 
          1
          
                def perform_later(*args)
        
      18. 
      
        
    18. 
          
          
                  job_or_instantiate(*args).enqueue
        
      19. 
      
        
    19. 
          
          
                end
        
      20. 
      
        
    20. 
          
          
          
        
      21. 
      
        
    21. 
          1
          
                protected
        
      22. 
      
        
    22. 
          1
          
                  def job_or_instantiate(*args)
        
      23. 
      
        
    23. 
          
          
                    args.first.is_a?(self) ? args.first : new(*args)
        
      24. 
      
        
    24. 
          
          
                  end
        
      25. 
      
        
    25. 
          
          
              end
        
      26. 
      
        
    26. 
          
          
          
        
      27. 
      
        
    27. 
          
          
              # Reschedules the job to be re-executed. This is useful in combination
        
      28. 
      
        
    28. 
          
          
              # with the +rescue_from+ option. When you rescue an exception from your job
        
      29. 
      
        
    29. 
          
          
              # you can ask Active Job to retry performing your job.
        
      30. 
      
        
    30. 
          
          
              #
        
      31. 
      
        
    31. 
          
          
              # ==== Options
        
      32. 
      
        
    32. 
          
          
              # * <tt>:wait</tt> - Enqueues the job with the specified delay
        
      33. 
      
        
    33. 
          
          
              # * <tt>:wait_until</tt> - Enqueues the job at the time specified
        
      34. 
      
        
    34. 
          
          
              # * <tt>:queue</tt> - Enqueues the job on the specified queue
        
      35. 
      
        
    35. 
          
          
              # * <tt>:priority</tt> - Enqueues the job with the specified priority
        
      36. 
      
        
    36. 
          
          
              #
        
      37. 
      
        
    37. 
          
          
              # ==== Examples
        
      38. 
      
        
    38. 
          
          
              #
        
      39.

              def retry_job(options={})
        
      49. 
      
        
    49. 
          
          
                enqueue options
        
      50. 
      
        
    50. 
          
          
              end
        
      51. 
      
        
    51. 
          
          
          
        
      52. 
      
        
    52. 
          
          
              # Enqueues the job to be performed by the queue adapter.
        
      53. 
      
        
    53. 
          
          
              #
        
      54. 
      
        
    54. 
          
          
              # ==== Options
        
      55. 
      
        
    55. 
          
          
              # * <tt>:wait</tt> - Enqueues the job with the specified delay
        
      56. 
      
        
    56. 
          
          
              # * <tt>:wait_until</tt> - Enqueues the job at the time specified
        
      57. 
      
        
    57. 
          
          
              # * <tt>:queue</tt> - Enqueues the job on the specified queue
        
      58. 
      
        
    58. 
          
          
              # * <tt>:priority</tt> - Enqueues the job with the specified priority
        
      59. 
      
        
    59. 
          
          
              #
        
      60. 
      
        
    60. 
          
          
              # ==== Examples
        
      61. 
      
        
    61. 
          
          
              #
        
      62. 
      
        
    62. 
          
          
              #    my_job_instance.enqueue
        
      63. 
      
        
    63. 
          
          
              #    my_job_instance.enqueue wait: 5.minutes
        
      64. 
      
        
    64. 
          
          
              #    my_job_instance.enqueue queue: :important
        
      65. 
      
        
    65. 
          
          
              #    my_job_instance.enqueue wait_until: Date.tomorrow.midnight
        
      66. 
      
        
    66. 
          
          
              #    my_job_instance.enqueue priority: 10
        
      67. 
      
        
    67. 
          1
          
              def enqueue(options={})
        
      68. 
      
        
    68. 
          
          
                self.scheduled_at = options[:wait].seconds.from_now.to_f if options[:wait]
        
      69. 
      
        
    69. 
          
          
                self.scheduled_at = options[:wait_until].to_f if options[:wait_until]
        
      70. 
      
        
    70. 
          
          
                self.queue_name   = self.class.queue_name_from_part(options[:queue]) if options[:queue]
        
      71. 
      
        
    71. 
          
          
                self.priority     = options[:priority].to_i if options[:priority]
        
      72. 
      
        
    72. 
          
          
                run_callbacks :enqueue do
        
      73. 
      
        
    73. 
          
          
                  if self.scheduled_at
        
      74. 
      
        
    74. 
          
          
                    self.class.queue_adapter.enqueue_at self, self.scheduled_at
        
      75. 
      
        
    75. 
          
          
                  else
        
      76. 
      
        
    76. 
          
          
                    self.class.queue_adapter.enqueue self
        
      77. 
      
        
    77. 
          
          
                  end
        
      78. 
      
        
    78. 
          
          
                end
        
      79. 
      
        
    79. 
          
          
                self
        
      80. 
      
        
    80. 
          
          
              end
        
      81. 
      
        
    81. 
          
          
            end
        
      82. 
      
        
    82. 
          
          
          end
        
      83.

              # Performs the job immediately. The job is not sent to the queueing adapter
        
      28. 
      
        
    28. 
          
          
              # but directly executed by blocking the execution of others until it's finished.

              #   MyJob.new(*args).perform_now
        
      31.

          1
          
              def perform_now
        
      32. 
      
        
    32. 
          
          
                deserialize_arguments_if_needed
        
      33. 
      
        
    33. 
          
          
                run_callbacks :perform do
        
      34. 
      
        
    34. 
          
          
                  perform(*arguments)
        
      35. 
      
        
    35. 
          
          
                end
        
      36.

                  def format(arg)
        
      98. 
      
        
    98. 
          
          
                    case arg
        
      99. 
      
        
    99. 
          
          
                    when Hash

    101.

      102.

    103.

                      arg.to_global_id rescue arg

          1
          
                def queue_adapter=(name_or_adapter_or_class)
        
      28. 
      
        
    28. 
          2
          
                  self._queue_adapter = interpret_adapter(name_or_adapter_or_class)
        
      29. 
      
        
    29. 
          
          
                end
        
      30. 
      
        
    30.

                def interpret_adapter(name_or_adapter_or_class)
        
      34. 
      
        
    34. 
          2
          
                  case name_or_adapter_or_class
        
      35. 
      
        
    35. 
          
          
                  when Symbol, String
        
      36. 
      
        
    36. 
          2
          
                    ActiveJob::QueueAdapters.lookup(name_or_adapter_or_class).new
        
      37. 
      
        
    37. 
          
          
                  else
        
      38. 
      
        
    38. 
          
          
                    if queue_adapter?(name_or_adapter_or_class)
        
      39. 
      
        
    39. 
          
          
                      name_or_adapter_or_class
        
      40. 
      
        
    40. 
          
          
                    elsif queue_adapter_class?(name_or_adapter_or_class)
        
      41. 
      
        
    41. 
          
          
                      ActiveSupport::Deprecation.warn "Passing an adapter class is deprecated " \
        
      42. 
      
        
    42. 
          
          
                        "and will be removed in Rails 5.1. Please pass an adapter name " \
        
      43. 
      
        
    43. 
          
          
                        "(.queue_adapter = :#{name_or_adapter_or_class.name.demodulize.remove('Adapter').underscore}) " \
        
      44. 
      
        
    44. 
          
          
                        "or an instance (.queue_adapter = #{name_or_adapter_or_class.name}.new) instead."
        
      45. 
      
        
    45. 
          
          
                        name_or_adapter_or_class.new
        
      46. 
      
        
    46. 
          
          
                    else
        
      47. 
      
        
    47. 
          
          
                      raise ArgumentError
        
      48. 
      
        
    48. 
          
          
                    end
        
      49. 
      
        
    49. 
          
          
                  end
        
      50. 
      
        
    50. 
          
          
                end
        
      51. 
      
        
    51. 
          
          
          
        
      52. 
      
        
    52. 
          1
          
                QUEUE_ADAPTER_METHODS = [:enqueue, :enqueue_at].freeze
        
      53. 
      
        
    53. 
          
          
          
        
      54. 
      
        
    54. 
          1
          
                def queue_adapter?(object)
        
      55. 
      
        
    55. 
          
          
                  QUEUE_ADAPTER_METHODS.all? { |meth| object.respond_to?(meth) }
        
      56. 
      
        
    56. 
          
          
                end
        
      57. 
      
        
    57. 
          
          
          
        
      58. 
      
        
    58. 
          1
          
                def queue_adapter_class?(object)
        
      59. 
      
        
    59. 
          
          
                  object.is_a?(Class) && QUEUE_ADAPTER_METHODS.all? { |meth| object.public_method_defined?(meth) }
        
      60. 
      
        
    60. 
          
          
                end
        
      61. 
      
        
    61. 
          
          
              end
        
      62. 
      
        
    62. 
          
          
            end
        
      63. 
      
        
    63. 
          
          
          end
        
      64.

    vendor/cache/ruby/2.3.0/gems/activejob-5.0.0.1/lib/active_job/queue_adapters.rb

    20 relevant lines. 20 lines covered and 0 lines missed. 
        
      
      
        
    1. 
          1
          
          module ActiveJob
        
      2. 
      
        
    2. 
          
          
            # == Active Job adapters
        
      3. 
      
        
    3. 
          
          
            #
        
      4. 
      
        
    4. 
          
          
            # Active Job has adapters for the following queueing backends:
        
      5. 
      
        
    5. 
          
          
            #
        
      6. 
      
        
    6. 
          
          
            # * {Backburner}[https://github.com/nesquena/backburner]
        
      7. 
      
        
    7. 
          
          
            # * {Delayed Job}[https://github.com/collectiveidea/delayed_job]
        
      8. 
      
        
    8. 
          
          
            # * {Qu}[https://github.com/bkeepers/qu]
        
      9. 
      
        
    9. 
          
          
            # * {Que}[https://github.com/chanks/que]
        
      10. 
      
        
    10. 
          
          
            # * {queue_classic}[https://github.com/QueueClassic/queue_classic]
        
      11. 
      
        
    11. 
          
          
            # * {Resque 1.x}[https://github.com/resque/resque/tree/1-x-stable]
        
      12. 
      
        
    12. 
          
          
            # * {Sidekiq}[http://sidekiq.org]
        
      13. 
      
        
    13. 
          
          
            # * {Sneakers}[https://github.com/jondot/sneakers]
        
      14. 
      
        
    14. 
          
          
            # * {Sucker Punch}[https://github.com/brandonhilkert/sucker_punch]
        
      15. 
      
        
    15. 
          
          
            # * {Active Job Async Job}[http://api.rubyonrails.org/classes/ActiveJob/QueueAdapters/AsyncAdapter.html]
        
      16. 
      
        
    16. 
          
          
            # * {Active Job Inline}[http://api.rubyonrails.org/classes/ActiveJob/QueueAdapters/InlineAdapter.html]
        
      17. 
      
        
    17. 
          
          
            #
        
      18. 
      
        
    18. 
          
          
            # === Backends Features
        
      19. 
      
        
    19. 
          
          
            #
        
      20. 
      
        
    20. 
          
          
            #   |                   | Async | Queues | Delayed    | Priorities | Timeout | Retries |
        
      21. 
      
        
    21. 
          
          
            #   |-------------------|-------|--------|------------|------------|---------|---------|
        
      22. 
      
        
    22. 
          
          
            #   | Backburner        | Yes   | Yes    | Yes        | Yes        | Job     | Global  |
        
      23. 
      
        
    23. 
          
          
            #   | Delayed Job       | Yes   | Yes    | Yes        | Job        | Global  | Global  |
        
      24. 
      
        
    24. 
          
          
            #   | Qu                | Yes   | Yes    | No         | No         | No      | Global  |
        
      25. 
      
        
    25. 
          
          
            #   | Que               | Yes   | Yes    | Yes        | Job        | No      | Job     |
        
      26. 
      
        
    26. 
          
          
            #   | queue_classic     | Yes   | Yes    | Yes*       | No         | No      | No      |
        
      27. 
      
        
    27. 
          
          
            #   | Resque            | Yes   | Yes    | Yes (Gem)  | Queue      | Global  | Yes     |
        
      28. 
      
        
    28. 
          
          
            #   | Sidekiq           | Yes   | Yes    | Yes        | Queue      | No      | Job     |
        
      29. 
      
        
    29. 
          
          
            #   | Sneakers          | Yes   | Yes    | No         | Queue      | Queue   | No      |
        
      30. 
      
        
    30. 
          
          
            #   | Sucker Punch      | Yes   | Yes    | Yes        | No         | No      | No      |
        
      31. 
      
        
    31. 
          
          
            #   | Active Job Async  | Yes   | Yes    | Yes        | No         | No      | No      |
        
      32. 
      
        
    32. 
          
          
            #   | Active Job Inline | No    | Yes    | N/A        | N/A        | N/A     | N/A     |
        
      33. 
      
        
    33. 
          
          
            #
        
      34. 
      
        
    34. 
          
          
            # ==== Async
        
      35. 
      
        
    35. 
          
          
            #
        
      36. 
      
        
    36. 
          
          
            # Yes: The Queue Adapter has the ability to run the job in a non-blocking manner.
        
      37. 
      
        
    37. 
          
          
            # It either runs on a separate or forked process, or on a different thread.
        
      38. 
      
        
    38. 
          
          
            #
        
      39. 
      
        
    39. 
          
          
            # No: The job is run in the same process.
        
      40. 
      
        
    40. 
          
          
            #
        
      41. 
      
        
    41. 
          
          
            # ==== Queues
        
      42. 
      
        
    42. 
          
          
            #
        
      43. 
      
        
    43. 
          
          
            # Yes: Jobs may set which queue they are run in with queue_as or by using the set
        
      44. 
      
        
    44. 
          
          
            # method.
        
      45. 
      
        
    45. 
          
          
            #
        
      46. 
      
        
    46. 
          
          
            # ==== Delayed
        
      47. 
      
        
    47. 
          
          
            #
        
      48. 
      
        
    48. 
          
          
            # Yes: The adapter will run the job in the future through perform_later.
        
      49. 
      
        
    49. 
          
          
            #
        
      50. 
      
        
    50. 
          
          
            # (Gem): An additional gem is required to use perform_later with this adapter.
        
      51. 
      
        
    51. 
          
          
            #
        
      52. 
      
        
    52. 
          
          
            # No: The adapter will run jobs at the next opportunity and cannot use perform_later.
        
      53. 
      
        
    53. 
          
          
            #
        
      54. 
      
        
    54. 
          
          
            # N/A: The adapter does not support queueing.
        
      55. 
      
        
    55. 
          
          
            #
        
      56. 
      
        
    56. 
          
          
            # NOTE:
        
      57. 
      
        
    57. 
          
          
            # queue_classic supports job scheduling since version 3.1.
        
      58. 
      
        
    58. 
          
          
            # For older versions you can use the queue_classic-later gem.
        
      59. 
      
        
    59. 
          
          
            #
        
      60. 
      
        
    60. 
          
          
            # ==== Priorities
        
      61. 
      
        
    61. 
          
          
            #
        
      62. 
      
        
    62. 
          
          
            # The order in which jobs are processed can be configured differently depending
        
      63. 
      
        
    63. 
          
          
            # on the adapter.
        
      64. 
      
        
    64. 
          
          
            #
        
      65. 
      
        
    65. 
          
          
            # Job: Any class inheriting from the adapter may set the priority on the job
        
      66. 
      
        
    66. 
          
          
            # object relative to other jobs.
        
      67. 
      
        
    67. 
          
          
            #
        
      68. 
      
        
    68. 
          
          
            # Queue: The adapter can set the priority for job queues, when setting a queue
        
      69. 
      
        
    69. 
          
          
            # with Active Job this will be respected.
        
      70. 
      
        
    70. 
          
          
            #
        
      71. 
      
        
    71. 
          
          
            # Yes: Allows the priority to be set on the job object, at the queue level or
        
      72. 
      
        
    72. 
          
          
            # as default configuration option.
        
      73. 
      
        
    73. 
          
          
            #
        
      74. 
      
        
    74. 
          
          
            # No: Does not allow the priority of jobs to be configured.
        
      75. 
      
        
    75. 
          
          
            #
        
      76. 
      
        
    76. 
          
          
            # N/A: The adapter does not support queueing, and therefore sorting them.
        
      77. 
      
        
    77. 
          
          
            #
        
      78. 
      
        
    78. 
          
          
            # ==== Timeout
        
      79. 
      
        
    79. 
          
          
            #
        
      80. 
      
        
    80. 
          
          
            # When a job will stop after the allotted time.
        
      81. 
      
        
    81. 
          
          
            #
        
      82. 
      
        
    82. 
          
          
            # Job: The timeout can be set for each instance of the job class.
        
      83. 
      
        
    83. 
          
          
            #
        
      84. 
      
        
    84. 
          
          
            # Queue: The timeout is set for all jobs on the queue.
        
      85. 
      
        
    85. 
          
          
            #
        
      86. 
      
        
    86. 
          
          
            # Global: The adapter is configured that all jobs have a maximum run time.
        
      87. 
      
        
    87. 
          
          
            #
        
      88. 
      
        
    88. 
          
          
            # N/A: This adapter does not run in a separate process, and therefore timeout
        
      89. 
      
        
    89. 
          
          
            # is unsupported.
        
      90. 
      
        
    90. 
          
          
            #
        
      91. 
      
        
    91. 
          
          
            # ==== Retries
        
      92. 
      
        
    92. 
          
          
            #
        
      93. 
      
        
    93. 
          
          
            # Job: The number of retries can be set per instance of the job class.
        
      94. 
      
        
    94. 
          
          
            #
        
      95. 
      
        
    95. 
          
          
            # Yes: The Number of retries can be configured globally, for each instance or
        
      96. 
      
        
    96. 
          
          
            # on the queue. This adapter may also present failed instances of the job class
        
      97. 
      
        
    97. 
          
          
            # that can be restarted.
        
      98. 
      
        
    98. 
          
          
            #
        
      99. 
      
        
    99. 
          
          
            # Global: The adapter has a global number of retries.
        
      100. 
      
        
    100. 
          
          
            #
        
      101. 
      
        
    101. 
          
          
            # N/A: The adapter does not run in a separate process, and therefore doesn't
        
      102. 
      
        
    102. 
          
          
            # support retries.
        
      103. 
      
        
    103. 
          
          
            #
        
      104. 
      
        
    104. 
          
          
            # === Async and Inline Queue Adapters
        
      105. 
      
        
    105. 
          
          
            #
        
      106. 
      
        
    106. 
          
          
            # Active Job has two built-in queue adapters intended for development and
        
      107. 
      
        
    107. 
          
          
            # testing: +:async+ and +:inline+.
        
      108. 
      
        
    108. 
          1

              ADAPTER = 'Adapter'.freeze

              class << self
        
      128. 
      
        
    128. 
          
          
                # Returns adapter for specified name.
        
      129. 
      
        
    129.

      130. 
      
        
    130. 
          
          
                #   ActiveJob::QueueAdapters.lookup(:sidekiq)
        
      131. 
      
        
    131. 
          
          
                #   # => ActiveJob::QueueAdapters::SidekiqAdapter
        
      132. 
      
        
    132. 
          1
          
                def lookup(name)
        
      133.

          2
          
                  const_get(name.to_s.camelize << ADAPTER)

          require 'securerandom'
        
      2.

      3.

          1

      4. 
      
        
    4. 
          1
          
          require 'concurrent/utility/processor_counter'
        
      5. 
      
        
    5. 
          
          
          
        
      6. 
      
        
    6. 
          1
          
          module ActiveJob
        
      7. 
      
        
    7. 
          1
          
            module QueueAdapters
        
      8. 
      
        
    8. 
          
          
              # == Active Job Async adapter
        
      9. 
      
        
    9. 
          
          
              #
        
      10. 
      
        
    10. 
          
          
              # The Async adapter runs jobs with an in-process thread pool.
        
      11. 
      
        
    11. 
          
          
              #
        
      12. 
      
        
    12. 
          
          
              # This is the default queue adapter. It's well-suited for dev/test since
        
      13. 
      
        
    13. 
          
          
              # it doesn't need an external infrastructure, but it's a poor fit for
        
      14. 
      
        
    14. 
          
          
              # production since it drops pending jobs on restart.
        
      15. 
      
        
    15. 
          
          
              #
        
      16. 
      
        
    16. 
          
          
              # To use this adapter, set queue adapter to +:async+:
        
      17. 
      
        
    17. 
          
          
              #
        
      18. 
      
        
    18. 
          
          
              #   config.active_job.queue_adapter = :async
        
      19. 
      
        
    19. 
          
          
              #
        
      20. 
      
        
    20. 
          
          
              # To configure the adapter's thread pool, instantiate the adapter and
        
      21. 
      
        
    21. 
          
          
              # pass your own config:
        
      22. 
      
        
    22. 
          
          
              #
        
      23. 
      
        
    23. 
          
          
              #   config.active_job.queue_adapter = ActiveJob::QueueAdapters::AsyncAdapter.new \
        
      24. 
      
        
    24. 
          
          
              #     min_threads: 1,
        
      25. 
      
        
    25. 
          
          
              #     max_threads: 2 * Concurrent.processor_count,
        
      26. 
      
        
    26. 
          
          
              #     idletime: 600.seconds
        
      27. 
      
        
    27. 
          
          
              #
        
      28. 
      
        
    28. 
          
          
              # The adapter uses a {Concurrent Ruby}[https://github.com/ruby-concurrency/concurrent-ruby] thread pool to schedule and execute
        
      29. 
      
        
    29. 
          
          
              # jobs. Since jobs share a single thread pool, long-running jobs will block
        
      30. 
      
        
    30. 
          
          
              # short-lived jobs. Fine for dev/test; bad for production.
        
      31. 
      
        
    31. 
          1
          
              class AsyncAdapter
        
      32. 
      
        
    32. 
          
          
                # See {Concurrent::ThreadPoolExecutor}[http://ruby-concurrency.github.io/concurrent-ruby/Concurrent/ThreadPoolExecutor.html] for executor options.
        
      33. 
      
        
    33. 
          1
          
                def initialize(**executor_options)
        
      34. 
      
        
    34. 
          2
          
                  @scheduler = Scheduler.new(**executor_options)
        
      35. 
      
        
    35. 
          
          
                end
        
      36. 
      
        
    36. 
          
          
          
        
      37. 
      
        
    37. 
          1
          
                def enqueue(job) #:nodoc:
        
      38. 
      
        
    38. 
          
          
                  @scheduler.enqueue JobWrapper.new(job), queue_name: job.queue_name
        
      39. 
      
        
    39. 
          
          
                end
        
      40. 
      
        
    40. 
          
          
          
        
      41. 
      
        
    41. 
          1
          
                def enqueue_at(job, timestamp) #:nodoc:
        
      42. 
      
        
    42. 
          
          
                  @scheduler.enqueue_at JobWrapper.new(job), timestamp, queue_name: job.queue_name
        
      43. 
      
        
    43. 
          
          
                end
        
      44. 
      
        
    44. 
          
          
          
        
      45. 
      
        
    45. 
          
          
                # Gracefully stop processing jobs. Finishes in-progress work and handles
        
      46. 
      
        
    46. 
          
          
                # any new jobs following the executor's fallback policy (`caller_runs`).
        
      47. 
      
        
    47. 
          
          
                # Waits for termination by default. Pass `wait: false` to continue.
        
      48. 
      
        
    48. 
          1
          
                def shutdown(wait: true) #:nodoc:
        
      49. 
      
        
    49. 
          
          
                  @scheduler.shutdown wait: wait
        
      50. 
      
        
    50. 
          
          
                end
        
      51. 
      
        
    51. 
          
          
          
        
      52. 
      
        
    52. 
          
          
                # Used for our test suite.
        
      53. 
      
        
    53. 
          1
          
                def immediate=(immediate) #:nodoc:
        
      54. 
      
        
    54. 
          
          
                  @scheduler.immediate = immediate
        
      55. 
      
        
    55. 
          
          
                end
        
      56. 
      
        
    56. 
          
          
          
        
      57. 
      
        
    57. 
          
          
                # Note that we don't actually need to serialize the jobs since we're
        
      58. 
      
        
    58. 
          
          
                # performing them in-process, but we do so anyway for parity with other
        
      59. 
      
        
    59. 
          
          
                # adapters and deployment environments. Otherwise, serialization bugs
        
      60. 
      
        
    60. 
          
          
                # may creep in undetected.
        
      61. 
      
        
    61. 
          1
          
                class JobWrapper #:nodoc:
        
      62. 
      
        
    62. 
          1
          
                  def initialize(job)
        
      63. 
      
        
    63. 
          
          
                    job.provider_job_id = SecureRandom.uuid
        
      64. 
      
        
    64. 
          
          
                    @job_data = job.serialize
        
      65. 
      
        
    65. 
          
          
                  end
        
      66. 
      
        
    66. 
          
          
          
        
      67. 
      
        
    67. 
          1
          
                  def perform
        
      68. 
      
        
    68. 
          
          
                    Base.execute @job_data
        
      69. 
      
        
    69. 
          
          
                  end
        
      70. 
      
        
    70. 
          
          
                end
        
      71. 
      
        
    71. 
          
          
          
        
      72. 
      
        
    72. 
          1
          
                class Scheduler #:nodoc:
        
      73. 
      
        
    73. 
          1
          
                  DEFAULT_EXECUTOR_OPTIONS = {
        
      74. 
      
        
    74. 
          
          
                    min_threads:     0,
        
      75. 
      
        
    75. 
          
          
                    max_threads:     Concurrent.processor_count,
        
      76. 
      
        
    76. 
          
          
                    auto_terminate:  true,
        
      77. 
      
        
    77. 
          
          
                    idletime:        60, # 1 minute
        
      78. 
      
        
    78. 
          
          
                    max_queue:       0, # unlimited
        
      79. 
      
        
    79. 
          
          
                    fallback_policy: :caller_runs # shouldn't matter -- 0 max queue
        
      80. 
      
        
    80. 
          
          
                  }.freeze
        
      81. 
      
        
    81. 
          
          
          
        
      82. 
      
        
    82. 
          1
          
                  attr_accessor :immediate
        
      83. 
      
        
    83. 
          
          
          
        
      84. 
      
        
    84. 
          1
          
                  def initialize(**options)
        
      85. 
      
        
    85. 
          2
          
                    self.immediate = false
        
      86. 
      
        
    86. 
          2
          
                    @immediate_executor = Concurrent::ImmediateExecutor.new
        
      87. 
      
        
    87. 
          2
          
                    @async_executor = Concurrent::ThreadPoolExecutor.new(DEFAULT_EXECUTOR_OPTIONS.merge(options))
        
      88. 
      
        
    88. 
          
          
                  end
        
      89. 
      
        
    89. 
          
          
          
        
      90. 
      
        
    90. 
          1
          
                  def enqueue(job, queue_name:)
        
      91. 
      
        
    91. 
          
          
                    executor.post(job, &:perform)
        
      92. 
      
        
    92. 
          
          
                  end
        
      93. 
      
        
    93. 
          
          
          
        
      94. 
      
        
    94. 
          1
          
                  def enqueue_at(job, timestamp, queue_name:)
        
      95. 
      
        
    95. 
          
          
                    delay = timestamp - Time.current.to_f
        
      96. 
      
        
    96. 
          
          
                    if delay > 0
        
      97. 
      
        
    97. 
          
          
                      Concurrent::ScheduledTask.execute(delay, args: [job], executor: executor, &:perform)
        
      98. 
      
        
    98.

      99. 
      
        
    99. 
          
          
                      enqueue(job, queue_name: queue_name)
        
      100. 
      
        
    100. 
          
          
                    end
        
      101. 
      
        
    101. 
          
          
                  end
        
      102. 
      
        
    102. 
          
          
          
        
      103. 
      
        
    103. 
          1
          
                  def shutdown(wait: true)
        
      104. 
      
        
    104. 
          
          
                    @async_executor.shutdown
        
      105. 
      
        
    105. 
          
          
                    @async_executor.wait_for_termination if wait
        
      106. 
      
        
    106. 
          
          
                  end
        
      107. 
      
        
    107. 
          
          
          
        
      108. 
      
        
    108.

      109. 
      
        
    109.

                def queue_name_from_part(part_name) #:nodoc:
        
      28. 
      
        
    28. 
          
          
                  queue_name = part_name || default_queue_name

      63. 
      
        
    63. 
          
          
          
        
      64.

                def rollback_records
        
      65. 
      
        
    65. 
          
          
                  ite = records.uniq
        
      66. 
      
        
    66. 
          
          
                  while record = ite.shift
        
      67. 
      
        
    67. 
          
          
                    record.rolledback!(force_restore_state: full_rollback?)

                  end

      70. 
      
        
    70.

                def before_commit_records

      83.

          1
          
                def commit_records
        
      84. 
      
        
    84. 
          
          
                  ite = records.uniq
        
      85. 
      
        
    85. 
          
          
                  while record = ite.shift
        
      86. 
      
        
    86. 
          
          
                    if @run_commit_callbacks
        
      87. 
      
        
    87. 
          
          
                      record.committed!
        
      88. 
      
        
    88. 
          
          
                    else
        
      89. 
      
        
    89. 
          
          
                      # if not running callbacks, only adds the record to the parent transaction
        
      90. 
      
        
    90. 
          
          
                      record.add_to_transaction

    91.

                  end
        
      93. 
      
        
    93. 
          
          
                ensure
        
      94. 
      
        
    94. 
          
          
                  ite.each { |i| i.committed!(should_run_callbacks: false) }
        
      95. 
      
        
    95. 
          
          
                end
        
      96. 
      
        
    96. 
          
          
          
        
      97. 
      
        
    97. 
          1
          
                def full_rollback?; true; end
        
      98. 
      
        
    98. 
          1
          
                def joinable?; @joinable; end

    99. 
          1
          
                def closed?; false; end

    100. 
          1
          
                def open?; !closed?; end
        
      101. 
      
        
    101. 
          
          
              end
        
      102. 
      
        
    102. 
          
          
          
        
      103.

              class SavepointTransaction < Transaction
        
      104. 
      
        
    104. 
          
          
          
        
      105. 
      
        
    105. 
          1
          
                def initialize(connection, savepoint_name, options, *args)
        
      106. 
      
        
    106. 
          
          
                  super(connection, options, *args)
        
      107. 
      
        
    107. 
          
          
                  if options[:isolation]
        
      108. 
      
        
    108. 
          
          
                    raise ActiveRecord::TransactionIsolationError, "cannot set transaction isolation in a nested transaction"
        
      109. 
      
        
    109. 
          
          
                  end
        
      110. 
      
        
    110. 
          
          
                  connection.create_savepoint(@savepoint_name = savepoint_name)
        
      111. 
      
        
    111. 
          
          
                end
        
      112. 
      
        
    112. 
          
          
          
        
      113. 
      
        
    113. 
          1
          
                def rollback
        
      114. 
      
        
    114. 
          
          
                  connection.rollback_to_savepoint(savepoint_name)
        
      115. 
      
        
    115. 
          
          
                  super
        
      116. 
      
        
    116. 
          
          
                end
        
      117. 
      
        
    117. 
          
          
          
        
      118. 
      
        
    118. 
          1
          
                def commit
        
      119. 
      
        
    119. 
          
          
                  connection.release_savepoint(savepoint_name)
        
      120. 
      
        
    120. 
          
          
                  super
        
      121. 
      
        
    121. 
          
          
                end
        
      122. 
      
        
    122. 
          
          
          
        
      123. 
      
        
    123.

              class RealTransaction < Transaction
        
      127. 
      
        
    127. 
          
          
          
        
      128.

          1
          
                def initialize(connection, options, *args)
        
      129.

                  super
        
      130. 
      
        
    130.

              class TransactionManager #:nodoc:

                def initialize(connection)
        
      150. 
      
        
    150. 
          1
          
                  @stack = []
        
      151. 
      
        
    151. 
          1
          
                  @connection = connection
