      635. 
      
        
    635. 
          
          
                  row = fixture.to_hash
        
      636. 
      
        
    636. 
          
          
          
        
      637. 
      
        
    637. 
          
          
                  if model_class
        
      638. 
      
        
    638. 
          
          
                    # fill in timestamp columns if they aren't specified and the model is set to record_timestamps
        
      639. 
      
        
    639. 
          
          
                    if model_class.record_timestamps
        
      640. 
      
        
    640. 
          
          
                      timestamp_column_names.each do |c_name|
        
      641. 
      
        
    641. 
          
          
                        row[c_name] = now unless row.key?(c_name)
        
      642. 
      
        
    642. 
          
          
                      end
        
      643. 
      
        
    643. 
          
          
                    end
        
      644. 
      
        
    644. 
          
          
          
        
      645. 
      
        
    645. 
          
          
                    # interpolate the fixture label
        
      646. 
      
        
    646. 
          
          
                    row.each do |key, value|
        
      647. 
      
        
    647. 
          
          
                      row[key] = value.gsub("$LABEL", label.to_s) if value.is_a?(String)
        
      648. 
      
        
    648. 
          
          
                    end
        
      649. 
      
        
    649. 
          
          
          
        
      650. 
      
        
    650. 
          
          
                    # generate a primary key if necessary
        
      651. 
      
        
    651. 
          
          
                    if has_primary_key_column? && !row.include?(primary_key_name)
        
      652. 
      
        
    652. 
          
          
                      row[primary_key_name] = ActiveRecord::FixtureSet.identify(label, primary_key_type)
        
      653. 
      
        
    653. 
          
          
                    end
        
      654. 
      
        
    654. 
          
          
          
        
      655. 
      
        
    655. 
          
          
                    # Resolve enums
        
      656. 
      
        
    656. 
          
          
                    model_class.defined_enums.each do |name, values|
        
      657. 
      
        
    657. 
          
          
                      if row.include?(name)
        
      658. 
      
        
    658. 
          
          
                        row[name] = values.fetch(row[name], row[name])
        
      659. 
      
        
    659. 
          
          
                      end
        
      660. 
      
        
    660. 
          
          
                    end
        
      661. 
      
        
    661. 
          
          
          
        
      662. 
      
        
    662. 
          
          
                    # If STI is used, find the correct subclass for association reflection
        
      663. 
      
        
    663. 
          
          
                    reflection_class =
        
      664. 
      
        
    664. 
          
          
                      if row.include?(inheritance_column_name)
        
      665. 
      
        
    665. 
          
          
                        row[inheritance_column_name].constantize rescue model_class
        
      666. 
      
        
    666. 
          
          
                      else
        
      667. 
      
        
    667. 
          
          
                        model_class
        
      668. 
      
        
    668. 
          
          
                      end
        
      669. 
      
        
    669. 
          
          
          
        
      670. 
      
        
    670. 
          
          
                    reflection_class._reflections.each_value do |association|
        
      671. 
      
        
    671. 
          
          
                      case association.macro
        
      672. 
      
        
    672. 
          
          
                      when :belongs_to
        
      673. 
      
        
    673. 
          
          
                        # Do not replace association name with association foreign key if they are named the same
        
      674. 
      
        
    674. 
          
          
                        fk_name = (association.options[:foreign_key] || "#{association.name}_id").to_s
        
      675. 
      
        
    675. 
          
          
          
        
      676. 
      
        
    676. 
          
          
                        if association.name.to_s != fk_name && value = row.delete(association.name.to_s)
        
      677. 
      
        
    677. 
          
          
                          if association.polymorphic? && value.sub!(/\s*\(([^\)]*)\)\s*$/, "")
        
      678. 
      
        
    678. 
          
          
                            # support polymorphic belongs_to as "label (Type)"
        
      679. 
      
        
    679. 
          
          
                            row[association.foreign_type] = $1
        
      680. 
      
        
    680. 
          
          
                          end
        
      681. 
      
        
    681. 
          
          
          
        
      682. 
      
        
    682. 
          
          
                          fk_type = reflection_class.type_for_attribute(fk_name).type
        
      683. 
      
        
    683. 
          
          
                          row[fk_name] = ActiveRecord::FixtureSet.identify(value, fk_type)
        
      684. 
      
        
    684. 
          
          
                        end
        
      685. 
      
        
    685. 
          
          
                      when :has_many
        
      686. 
      
        
    686. 
          
          
                        if association.options[:through]
        
      687. 
      
        
    687. 
          
          
                          add_join_records(rows, row, HasManyThroughProxy.new(association))
        
      688. 
      
        
    688. 
          
          
                        end
        
      689. 
      
        
    689. 
          
          
                      end
        
      690. 
      
        
    690. 
          
          
                    end
        
      691. 
      
        
    691. 
          
          
                  end
        
      692. 
      
        
    692. 
          
          
          
        
      693. 
      
        
    693. 
          
          
                  row
        
      694. 
      
        
    694. 
          
          
                end
        
      695. 
      
        
    695. 
          
          
                rows
        
      696. 
      
        
    696. 
          
          
              end
        
      697. 
      
        
    697. 
          
          
          
        
      698. 
      
        
    698. 
          1
          
              class ReflectionProxy # :nodoc:
        
      699. 
      
        
    699. 
          1
          
                def initialize(association)
        
      700. 
      
        
    700. 
          
          
                  @association = association
        
      701. 
      
        
    701. 
          
          
                end
        
      702. 
      
        
    702. 
          
          
          
        
      703. 
      
        
    703. 
          1
          
                def join_table
        
      704. 
      
        
    704. 
          
          
                  @association.join_table
        
      705. 
      
        
    705. 
          
          
                end
        
      706. 
      
        
    706. 
          
          
          
        
      707. 
      
        
    707. 
          1
          
                def name
        
      708. 
      
        
    708. 
          
          
                  @association.name
        
      709. 
      
        
    709. 
          
          
                end
        
      710. 
      
        
    710. 
          
          
          
        
      711. 
      
        
    711. 
          1
          
                def primary_key_type
        
      712. 
      
        
    712. 
          
          
                  @association.klass.type_for_attribute(@association.klass.primary_key).type
        
      713. 
      
        
    713. 
          
          
                end
        
      714. 
      
        
    714. 
          
          
              end
        
      715. 
      
        
    715. 
          
          
          
        
      716. 
      
        
    716. 
          1
          
              class HasManyThroughProxy < ReflectionProxy # :nodoc:
        
      717. 
      
        
    717. 
          1
          
                def rhs_key
        
      718. 
      
        
    718. 
          
          
                  @association.foreign_key
        
      719. 
      
        
    719. 
          
          
                end
        
      720. 
      
        
    720. 
          
          
          
        
      721. 
      
        
    721. 
          1
          
                def lhs_key
        
      722. 
      
        
    722. 
          
          
                  @association.through_reflection.foreign_key
        
      723. 
      
        
    723. 
          
          
                end
        
      724. 
      
        
    724. 
          
          
          
        
      725. 
      
        
    725. 
          1
          
                def join_table
        
      726. 
      
        
    726. 
          
          
                  @association.through_reflection.table_name
        
      727. 
      
        
    727. 
          
          
                end
        
      728. 
      
        
    728. 
          
          
              end
        
      729. 
      
        
    729. 
          
          
          
        
      730. 
      
        
    730. 
          1
          
              private
        
      731. 
      
        
    731. 
          1
          
                def primary_key_name
        
      732. 
      
        
    732. 
          
          
                  @primary_key_name ||= model_class && model_class.primary_key
        
      733. 
      
        
    733. 
          
          
                end
        
      734. 
      
        
    734. 
          
          
          
        
      735. 
      
        
    735. 
          1
          
                def primary_key_type
        
      736. 
      
        
    736. 
          
          
                  @primary_key_type ||= model_class && model_class.type_for_attribute(model_class.primary_key).type
        
      737. 
      
        
    737. 
          
          
                end
        
      738. 
      
        
    738. 
          
          
          
        
      739. 
      
        
    739. 
          1
          
                def add_join_records(rows, row, association)
        
      740. 
      
        
    740. 
          
          
                  # This is the case when the join table has no fixtures file
        
      741. 
      
        
    741. 
          
          
                  if (targets = row.delete(association.name.to_s))
        
      742. 
      
        
    742. 
          
          
                    table_name  = association.join_table
        
      743. 
      
        
    743. 
          
          
                    column_type = association.primary_key_type
        
      744. 
      
        
    744. 
          
          
                    lhs_key     = association.lhs_key
        
      745. 
      
        
    745. 
          
          
                    rhs_key     = association.rhs_key
        
      746. 
      
        
    746. 
          
          
          
        
      747. 
      
        
    747. 
          
          
                    targets = targets.is_a?(Array) ? targets : targets.split(/\s*,\s*/)
        
      748. 
      
        
    748. 
          
          
                    rows[table_name].concat targets.map { |target|
        
      749. 
      
        
    749. 
          
          
                      { lhs_key => row[primary_key_name],
        
      750. 
      
        
    750. 
          
          
                        rhs_key => ActiveRecord::FixtureSet.identify(target, column_type) }
        
      751. 
      
        
    751. 
          
          
                    }
        
      752. 
      
        
    752. 
          
          
                  end
        
      753. 
      
        
    753. 
          
          
                end
        
      754. 
      
        
    754. 
          
          
          
        
      755. 
      
        
    755. 
          1
          
                def has_primary_key_column?
        
      756. 
      
        
    756. 
          
          
                  @has_primary_key_column ||= primary_key_name &&
        
      757. 
      
        
    757. 
          
          
                    model_class.columns.any? { |c| c.name == primary_key_name }
        
      758. 
      
        
    758. 
          
          
                end
        
      759. 
      
        
    759. 
          
          
          
        
      760. 
      
        
    760. 
          1
          
                def timestamp_column_names
        
      761. 
      
        
    761. 
          
          
                  @timestamp_column_names ||=
        
      762. 
      
        
    762. 
          
          
                    %w(created_at created_on updated_at updated_on) & column_names
        
      763. 
      
        
    763. 
          
          
                end
        
      764. 
      
        
    764. 
          
          
          
        
      765. 
      
        
    765. 
          1
          
                def inheritance_column_name
        
      766. 
      
        
    766. 
          
          
                  @inheritance_column_name ||= model_class && model_class.inheritance_column
        
      767. 
      
        
    767. 
          
          
                end
        
      768. 
      
        
    768. 
          
          
          
        
      769. 
      
        
    769. 
          1
          
                def column_names
        
      770. 
      
        
    770. 
          
          
                  @column_names ||= @connection.columns(@table_name).collect(&:name)
        
      771. 
      
        
    771. 
          
          
                end
        
      772. 
      
        
    772. 
          
          
          
        
      773. 
      
        
    773. 
          1
          
                def model_class=(class_name)
        
      774. 
      
        
    774. 
          
          
                  if class_name.is_a?(Class) # TODO: Should be an AR::Base type class, or any?
        
      775. 
      
        
    775. 
          
          
                    @model_class = class_name
        
      776. 
      
        
    776. 
          
          
                  else
        
      777. 
      
        
    777. 
          
          
                    @model_class = class_name.safe_constantize if class_name
        
      778. 
      
        
    778. 
          
          
                  end
        
      779. 
      
        
    779. 
          
          
                end
        
      780. 
      
        
    780. 
          
          
          
        
      781. 
      
        
    781. 
          
          
                # Loads the fixtures from the YAML file at +path+.
        
      782. 
      
        
    782. 
          
          
                # If the file sets the +model_class+ and current instance value is not set,
        
      783. 
      
        
    783. 
          
          
                # it uses the file value.
        
      784. 
      
        
    784. 
          1
          
                def read_fixture_files(path)
        
      785. 
      
        
    785. 
          
          
                  yaml_files = Dir["#{path}/{**,*}/*.yml"].select { |f|
        
      786. 
      
        
    786. 
          
          
                    ::File.file?(f)
        
      787. 
      
        
    787. 
          
          
                  } + [yaml_file_path(path)]
        
      788. 
      
        
    788. 
          
          
          
        
      789. 
      
        
    789. 
          
          
                  yaml_files.each_with_object({}) do |file, fixtures|
        
      790. 
      
        
    790. 
          
          
                    FixtureSet::File.open(file) do |fh|
        
      791. 
      
        
    791. 
          
          
                      self.model_class ||= fh.model_class if fh.model_class
        
      792. 
      
        
    792. 
          
          
                      fh.each do |fixture_name, row|
        
      793. 
      
        
    793. 
          
          
                        fixtures[fixture_name] = ActiveRecord::Fixture.new(row, model_class)
        
      794. 
      
        
    794. 
          
          
                      end
        
      795. 
      
        
    795. 
          
          
                    end
        
      796. 
      
        
    796. 
          
          
                  end
        
      797. 
      
        
    797. 
          
          
                end
        
      798. 
      
        
    798. 
          
          
          
        
      799. 
      
        
    799. 
          1
          
                def yaml_file_path(path)
        
      800. 
      
        
    800. 
          
          
                  "#{path}.yml"
        
      801. 
      
        
    801. 
          
          
                end
        
      802. 
      
        
    802. 
          
          
          
        
      803. 
      
        
    803. 
          
          
            end
        
      804. 
      
        
    804. 
          
          
          
        
      805. 
      
        
    805. 
          1
          
            class Fixture #:nodoc:
        
      806. 
      
        
    806. 
          1
          
              include Enumerable
        
      807. 
      
        
    807. 
          
          
          
        
      808. 
      
        
    808. 
          1
          
              class FixtureError < StandardError #:nodoc:
        
      809. 
      
        
    809. 
          
          
              end
        
      810. 
      
        
    810. 
          
          
          
        
      811. 
      
        
    811. 
          1
          
              class FormatError < FixtureError #:nodoc:
        
      812. 
      
        
    812. 
          
          
              end
        
      813. 
      
        
    813. 
          
          
          
        
      814. 
      
        
    814. 
          1
          
              attr_reader :model_class, :fixture
        
      815. 
      
        
    815. 
          
          
          
        
      816. 
      
        
    816. 
          1
          
              def initialize(fixture, model_class)
        
      817. 
      
        
    817. 
          
          
                @fixture     = fixture
        
      818. 
      
        
    818. 
          
          
                @model_class = model_class
        
      819. 
      
        
    819. 
          
          
              end
        
      820. 
      
        
    820. 
          
          
          
        
      821. 
      
        
    821. 
          1
          
              def class_name
        
      822. 
      
        
    822. 
          
          
                model_class.name if model_class
        
      823. 
      
        
    823. 
          
          
              end
        
      824. 
      
        
    824. 
          
          
          
        
      825. 
      
        
    825. 
          1
          
              def each
        
      826. 
      
        
    826. 
          
          
                fixture.each { |item| yield item }
        
      827. 
      
        
    827. 
          
          
              end
        
      828. 
      
        
    828. 
          
          
          
        
      829. 
      
        
    829. 
          1
          
              def [](key)
        
      830. 
      
        
    830. 
          
          
                fixture[key]
        
      831. 
      
        
    831. 
          
          
              end
        
      832. 
      
        
    832. 
          
          
          
        
      833. 
      
        
    833. 
          1
          
              alias :to_hash :fixture
        
      834. 
      
        
    834. 
          
          
          
        
      835. 
      
        
    835. 
          1
          
              def find
        
      836. 
      
        
    836. 
          
          
                if model_class
        
      837. 
      
        
    837. 
          
          
                  model_class.unscoped do
        
      838. 
      
        
    838. 
          
          
                    model_class.find(fixture[model_class.primary_key])
        
      839. 
      
        
    839. 
          
          
                  end
        
      840. 
      
        
    840. 
          
          
                else
        
      841. 
      
        
    841. 
          
          
                  raise FixtureClassNotFound, "No class attached to find."
        
      842. 
      
        
    842. 
          
          
                end
        
      843. 
      
        
    843. 
          
          
              end
        
      844. 
      
        
    844. 
          
          
            end
        
      845. 
      
        
    845. 
          
          
          end
        
      846. 
      
        
    846. 
          
          
          
        
      847. 
      
        
    847. 
          1
          
          module ActiveRecord
        
      848. 
      
        
    848. 
          1
          
            module TestFixtures
        
      849. 
      
        
    849. 
          1
          
              extend ActiveSupport::Concern
        
      850. 
      
        
    850. 
          
          
          
        
      851. 
      
        
    851. 
          1
          
              def before_setup # :nodoc:
        
      852. 
      
        
    852. 
          
          
                setup_fixtures
        
      853. 
      
        
    853. 
          
          
                super
        
      854. 
      
        
    854. 
          
          
              end
        
      855. 
      
        
    855. 
          
          
          
        
      856. 
      
        
    856. 
          1
          
              def after_teardown # :nodoc:
        
      857. 
      
        
    857. 
          
          
                super
        
      858. 
      
        
    858. 
          
          
                teardown_fixtures
        
      859. 
      
        
    859. 
          
          
              end
        
      860. 
      
        
    860. 
          
          
          
        
      861. 
      
        
    861. 
          1
          
              included do
        
      862. 
      
        
    862. 
          
          
                class_attribute :fixture_path, :instance_writer => false
        
      863. 
      
        
    863. 
          
          
                class_attribute :fixture_table_names
        
      864. 
      
        
    864. 
          
          
                class_attribute :fixture_class_names
        
      865. 
      
        
    865. 
          
          
                class_attribute :use_transactional_tests
        
      866. 
      
        
    866. 
          
          
                class_attribute :use_transactional_fixtures
        
      867. 
      
        
    867. 
          
          
                class_attribute :use_instantiated_fixtures # true, false, or :no_instances
        
      868. 
      
        
    868. 
          
          
                class_attribute :pre_loaded_fixtures
        
      869. 
      
        
    869. 
          
          
                class_attribute :config
        
      870. 
      
        
    870. 
          
          
          
        
      871. 
      
        
    871. 
          
          
                singleton_class.deprecate 'use_transactional_fixtures=' => 'use use_transactional_tests= instead'
        
      872. 
      
        
    872. 
          
          
          
        
      873. 
      
        
    873. 
          
          
                self.fixture_table_names = []
        
      874. 
      
        
    874. 
          
          
                self.use_instantiated_fixtures = false
        
      875. 
      
        
    875. 
          
          
                self.pre_loaded_fixtures = false
        
      876. 
      
        
    876. 
          
          
                self.config = ActiveRecord::Base
        
      877. 
      
        
    877. 
          
          
          
        
      878. 
      
        
    878. 
          
          
                self.fixture_class_names = {}
        
      879. 
      
        
    879. 
          
          
          
        
      880. 
      
        
    880. 
          
          
                silence_warnings do
        
      881. 
      
        
    881. 
          
          
                  define_singleton_method :use_transactional_tests do
        
      882. 
      
        
    882. 
          
          
                    if use_transactional_fixtures.nil?
        
      883. 
      
        
    883. 
          
          
                      true
        
      884. 
      
        
    884. 
          
          
                    else
        
      885. 
      
        
    885. 
          
          
                      use_transactional_fixtures
        
      886. 
      
        
    886. 
          
          
                    end
        
      887. 
      
        
    887. 
          
          
                  end
        
      888. 
      
        
    888. 
          
          
                end
        
      889. 
      
        
    889. 
          
          
              end
        
      890. 
      
        
    890. 
          
          
          
        
      891. 
      
        
    891. 
          1
          
              module ClassMethods
        
      892. 
      
        
    892. 
          
          
                # Sets the model class for a fixture when the class name cannot be inferred from the fixture name.
        
      893. 
      
        
    893. 
          
          
                #
        
      894. 
      
        
    894. 
          
          
                # Examples:
        
      895. 
      
        
    895. 
          
          
                #
        
      896. 
      
        
    896. 
          
          
                #   set_fixture_class some_fixture:        SomeModel,
        
      897. 
      
        
    897. 
          
          
                #                     'namespaced/fixture' => Another::Model
        
      898. 
      
        
    898. 
          
          
                #
        
      899. 
      
        
    899. 
          
          
                # The keys must be the fixture names, that coincide with the short paths to the fixture files.
        
      900. 
      
        
    900. 
          1
          
                def set_fixture_class(class_names = {})
        
      901. 
      
        
    901. 
          
          
                  self.fixture_class_names = self.fixture_class_names.merge(class_names.stringify_keys)
        
      902. 
      
        
    902. 
          
          
                end
        
      903. 
      
        
    903. 
          
          
          
        
      904. 
      
        
    904. 
          1
          
                def fixtures(*fixture_set_names)
        
      905. 
      
        
    905. 
          
          
                  if fixture_set_names.first == :all
        
      906. 
      
        
    906. 
          
          
                    fixture_set_names = Dir["#{fixture_path}/{**,*}/*.{yml}"]
        
      907. 
      
        
    907. 
          
          
                    fixture_set_names.map! { |f| f[(fixture_path.to_s.size + 1)..-5] }
        
      908. 
      
        
    908. 
          
          
                  else
        
      909. 
      
        
    909. 
          
          
                    fixture_set_names = fixture_set_names.flatten.map(&:to_s)
        
      910. 
      
        
    910. 
          
          
                  end
        
      911. 
      
        
    911. 
          
          
          
        
      912. 
      
        
    912. 
          
          
                  self.fixture_table_names |= fixture_set_names
        
      913. 
      
        
    913. 
          
          
                  setup_fixture_accessors(fixture_set_names)
        
      914. 
      
        
    914. 
          
          
                end
        
      915. 
      
        
    915. 
          
          
          
        
      916. 
      
        
    916. 
          1
          
                def setup_fixture_accessors(fixture_set_names = nil)
        
      917. 
      
        
    917. 
          
          
                  fixture_set_names = Array(fixture_set_names || fixture_table_names)
        
      918. 
      
        
    918. 
          
          
                  methods = Module.new do
        
      919. 
      
        
    919. 
          
          
                    fixture_set_names.each do |fs_name|
        
      920. 
      
        
    920. 
          
          
                      fs_name = fs_name.to_s
        
      921. 
      
        
    921. 
          
          
                      accessor_name = fs_name.tr('/', '_').to_sym
        
      922. 
      
        
    922. 
          
          
          
        
      923. 
      
        
    923. 
          
          
                      define_method(accessor_name) do |*fixture_names|
        
      924. 
      
        
    924. 
          
          
                        force_reload = fixture_names.pop if fixture_names.last == true || fixture_names.last == :reload
        
      925. 
      
        
    925. 
          
          
          
        
      926. 
      
        
    926. 
          
          
                        @fixture_cache[fs_name] ||= {}
        
      927. 
      
        
    927. 
          
          
          
        
      928. 
      
        
    928. 
          
          
                        instances = fixture_names.map do |f_name|
        
      929. 
      
        
    929. 
          
          
                          f_name = f_name.to_s if f_name.is_a?(Symbol)
        
      930. 
      
        
    930. 
          
          
                          @fixture_cache[fs_name].delete(f_name) if force_reload
        
      931. 
      
        
    931. 
          
          
          
        
      932. 
      
        
    932. 
          
          
                          if @loaded_fixtures[fs_name][f_name]
        
      933. 
      
        
    933. 
          
          
                            @fixture_cache[fs_name][f_name] ||= @loaded_fixtures[fs_name][f_name].find
        
      934. 
      
        
    934. 
          
          
                          else
        
      935. 
      
        
    935. 
          
          
                            raise StandardError, "No fixture named '#{f_name}' found for fixture set '#{fs_name}'"
        
      936. 
      
        
    936. 
          
          
                          end
        
      937. 
      
        
    937. 
          
          
                        end
        
      938. 
      
        
    938. 
          
          
          
        
      939. 
      
        
    939. 
          
          
                        instances.size == 1 ? instances.first : instances
        
      940. 
      
        
    940. 
          
          
                      end
        
      941. 
      
        
    941. 
          
          
                      private accessor_name
        
      942. 
      
        
    942. 
          
          
                    end
        
      943. 
      
        
    943. 
          
          
                  end
        
      944. 
      
        
    944. 
          
          
                  include methods
        
      945.

      946. 
      
        
    946. 
          
          
          
        
      947. 
      
        
    947. 
          1
          
                def uses_transaction(*methods)
        
      948. 
      
        
    948. 
          
          
                  @uses_transaction = [] unless defined?(@uses_transaction)
        
      949. 
      
        
    949. 
          
          
                  @uses_transaction.concat methods.map(&:to_s)
        
      950. 
      
        
    950. 
          
          
                end
        
      951. 
      
        
    951. 
          
          
          
        
      952. 
      
        
    952. 
          1
          
                def uses_transaction?(method)
        
      953. 
      
        
    953. 
          
          
                  @uses_transaction = [] unless defined?(@uses_transaction)
        
      954. 
      
        
    954. 
          
          
                  @uses_transaction.include?(method.to_s)
        
      955. 
      
        
    955. 
          
          
                end
        
      956. 
      
        
    956. 
          
          
              end
        
      957. 
      
        
    957. 
          
          
          
        
      958. 
      
        
    958. 
          1
          
              def run_in_transaction?
        
      959. 
      
        
    959. 
          
          
                use_transactional_tests &&
        
      960. 
      
        
    960. 
          
          
                  !self.class.uses_transaction?(method_name)
        
      961. 
      
        
    961. 
          
          
              end
        
      962. 
      
        
    962. 
          
          
          
        
      963. 
      
        
    963. 
          1
          
              def setup_fixtures(config = ActiveRecord::Base)
        
      964. 
      
        
    964. 
          
          
                if pre_loaded_fixtures && !use_transactional_tests
        
      965. 
      
        
    965. 
          
          
                  raise RuntimeError, 'pre_loaded_fixtures requires use_transactional_tests'
        
      966. 
      
        
    966. 
          
          
                end
        
      967. 
      
        
    967. 
          
          
          
        
      968. 
      
        
    968. 
          
          
                @fixture_cache = {}
        
      969. 
      
        
    969. 
          
          
                @fixture_connections = []
        
      970. 
      
        
    970. 
          
          
                @@already_loaded_fixtures ||= {}
        
      971. 
      
        
    971. 
          
          
          
        
      972. 
      
        
    972. 
          
          
                # Load fixtures once and begin transaction.
        
      973. 
      
        
    973. 
          
          
                if run_in_transaction?
        
      974. 
      
        
    974. 
          
          
                  if @@already_loaded_fixtures[self.class]
        
      975. 
      
        
    975. 
          
          
                    @loaded_fixtures = @@already_loaded_fixtures[self.class]
        
      976. 
      
        
    976. 
          
          
                  else
        
      977. 
      
        
    977. 
          
          
                    @loaded_fixtures = load_fixtures(config)
        
      978. 
      
        
    978. 
          
          
                    @@already_loaded_fixtures[self.class] = @loaded_fixtures
        
      979. 
      
        
    979. 
          
          
                  end
        
      980. 
      
        
    980. 
          
          
                  @fixture_connections = enlist_fixture_connections
        
      981. 
      
        
    981. 
          
          
                  @fixture_connections.each do |connection|
        
      982. 
      
        
    982. 
          
          
                    connection.begin_transaction joinable: false
        
      983. 
      
        
    983. 
          
          
                  end
        
      984. 
      
        
    984. 
          
          
                # Load fixtures for every test.
        
      985. 
      
        
    985. 
          
          
                else
        
      986. 
      
        
    986. 
          
          
                  ActiveRecord::FixtureSet.reset_cache
        
      987. 
      
        
    987. 
          
          
                  @@already_loaded_fixtures[self.class] = nil
        
      988. 
      
        
    988. 
          
          
                  @loaded_fixtures = load_fixtures(config)
        
      989. 
      
        
    989. 
          
          
                end
        
      990. 
      
        
    990. 
          
          
          
        
      991. 
      
        
    991. 
          
          
                # Instantiate fixtures for every test if requested.
        
      992. 
      
        
    992. 
          
          
                instantiate_fixtures if use_instantiated_fixtures
        
      993. 
      
        
    993. 
          
          
              end
        
      994. 
      
        
    994. 
          
          
          
        
      995. 
      
        
    995. 
          1
          
              def teardown_fixtures
        
      996. 
      
        
    996. 
          
          
                # Rollback changes if a transaction is active.
        
      997. 
      
        
    997. 
          
          
                if run_in_transaction?
        
      998. 
      
        
    998. 
          
          
                  @fixture_connections.each do |connection|
        
      999. 
      
        
    999. 
          
          
                    connection.rollback_transaction if connection.transaction_open?
        
      1000. 
      
        
    1000. 
          
          
                  end
        
      1001. 
      
        
    1001. 
          
          
                  @fixture_connections.clear
        
      1002. 
      
        
    1002. 
          
          
                else
        
      1003. 
      
        
    1003. 
          
          
                  ActiveRecord::FixtureSet.reset_cache
        
      1004. 
      
        
    1004. 
          
          
                end
        
      1005. 
      
        
    1005. 
          
          
          
        
      1006. 
      
        
    1006. 
          
          
                ActiveRecord::Base.clear_active_connections!
        
      1007.

              end
        
      1008. 
      
        
    1008. 
          
          
          
        
      1009.

          1
          
              def enlist_fixture_connections
        
      1010. 
      
        
    1010. 
          
          
                ActiveRecord::Base.connection_handler.connection_pool_list.map(&:connection)
        
      1011. 
      
        
    1011. 
          
          
              end
        
      1012. 
      
        
    1012. 
          
          
          
        
      1013.

          1
          
              private
        
      1014.

                def load_fixtures(config)
        
      1015. 
      
        
    1015. 
          
          
                  fixtures = ActiveRecord::FixtureSet.create_fixtures(fixture_path, fixture_table_names, fixture_class_names, config)

    1016. 
          
          
                  Hash[fixtures.map { |f| [f.name, f] }]
        
      1017. 
      
        
    1017. 
          
          
                end
        
      1018. 
      
        
    1018. 
          
          
          
        
      1019.

          1
          
                def instantiate_fixtures
        
      1020. 
      
        
    1020. 
          
          
                  if pre_loaded_fixtures
        
      1021. 
      
        
    1021. 
          
          
                    raise RuntimeError, 'Load fixtures before instantiating them.' if ActiveRecord::FixtureSet.all_loaded_fixtures.empty?
        
      1022. 
      
        
    1022. 
          
          
                    ActiveRecord::FixtureSet.instantiate_all_loaded_fixtures(self, load_instances?)
        
      1023. 
      
        
    1023. 
          
          
                  else
        
      1024. 
      
        
    1024. 
          
          
                    raise RuntimeError, 'Load fixtures before instantiating them.' if @loaded_fixtures.nil?
        
      1025. 
      
        
    1025. 
          
          
                    @loaded_fixtures.each_value do |fixture_set|
        
      1026. 
      
        
    1026. 
          
          
                      ActiveRecord::FixtureSet.instantiate_fixtures(self, fixture_set, load_instances?)
        
      1027. 
      
        
    1027. 
          
          
                    end
        
      1028. 
      
        
    1028. 
          
          
                  end
        
      1029. 
      
        
    1029. 
          
          
                end
        
      1030. 
      
        
    1030. 
          
          
          
        
      1031. 
      
        
    1031. 
          1
          
                def load_instances?
        
      1032. 
      
        
    1032. 
          
          
                  use_instantiated_fixtures != :no_instances
        
      1033. 
      
        
    1033. 
          
          
                end
        
      1034. 
      
        
    1034. 
          
          
            end
        
      1035. 
      
        
    1035. 
          
          
          end

          1

      9. 
      
        
    9. 
          
          
          
        
      10. 
      
        
    10. 
          
          
              # Generates a v5 non-random UUID (Universally Unique IDentifier).
        
      11. 
      
        
    11. 
          
          
              #
        
      12. 
      
        
    12. 
          
          
              # Using Digest::MD5 generates version 3 UUIDs; Digest::SHA1 generates version 5 UUIDs.
        
      13. 
      
        
    13. 
          
          
              # uuid_from_hash always generates the same UUID for a given name and namespace combination.
        
      14. 
      
        
    14. 
          
          
              #
        
      15. 
      
        
    15. 
          
          
              # See RFC 4122 for details of UUID at: http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc4122.txt
        
      16. 
      
        
    16. 
          1
          
              def self.uuid_from_hash(hash_class, uuid_namespace, name)
        
      17. 
      
        
    17. 
          
          
                if hash_class == Digest::MD5
        
      18. 
      
        
    18. 
          
          
                  version = 3
        
      19. 
      
        
    19. 
          
          
                elsif hash_class == Digest::SHA1
        
      20. 
      
        
    20. 
          
          
                  version = 5
        
      21. 
      
        
    21. 
          
          
                else
        
      22. 
      
        
    22. 
          
          
                  raise ArgumentError, "Expected Digest::SHA1 or Digest::MD5, got #{hash_class.name}."
        
      23. 
      
        
    23. 
          
          
                end
        
      24. 
      
        
    24. 
          
          
          
        
      25. 
      
        
    25. 
          
          
                hash = hash_class.new
        
      26. 
      
        
    26. 
          
          
                hash.update(uuid_namespace)
        
      27. 
      
        
    27. 
          
          
                hash.update(name)
        
      28. 
      
        
    28. 
          
          
          
        
      29. 
      
        
    29. 
          
          
                ary = hash.digest.unpack('NnnnnN')
        
      30. 
      
        
    30. 
          
          
                ary[2] = (ary[2] & 0x0FFF) | (version << 12)
        
      31. 
      
        
    31. 
          
          
                ary[3] = (ary[3] & 0x3FFF) | 0x8000
        
      32. 
      
        
    32. 
          
          
          
        
      33. 
      
        
    33. 
          
          
                "%08x-%04x-%04x-%04x-%04x%08x" % ary
        
      34. 
      
        
    34. 
          
          
              end
        
      35. 
      
        
    35. 
          
          
          
        
      36. 
      
        
    36. 
          
          
              # Convenience method for uuid_from_hash using Digest::MD5.
        
      37. 
      
        
    37. 
          1
          
              def self.uuid_v3(uuid_namespace, name)
        
      38. 
      
        
    38. 
          
          
                self.uuid_from_hash(Digest::MD5, uuid_namespace, name)
        
      39. 
      
        
    39. 
          
          
              end
        
      40. 
      
        
    40. 
          
          
          
        
      41. 
      
        
    41. 
          
          
              # Convenience method for uuid_from_hash using Digest::SHA1.
        
      42. 
      
        
    42. 
          1
          
              def self.uuid_v5(uuid_namespace, name)
        
      43. 
      
        
    43. 
          
          
                self.uuid_from_hash(Digest::SHA1, uuid_namespace, name)
        
      44. 
      
        
    44. 
          
          
              end
        
      45. 
      
        
    45. 
          
          
          
        
      46. 
      
        
    46. 
          
          
              # Convenience method for SecureRandom.uuid.
        
      47. 
      
        
    47. 
          1
          
              def self.uuid_v4
        
      48. 
      
        
    48. 
          
          
                SecureRandom.uuid
        
      49. 
      
        
    49. 
          
          
              end
        
      50. 
      
        
    50. 
          
          
            end
        
      51. 
      
        
    51. 
          
          
          end
        
      52.

      17. 
      
        
    17. 
          
          
          
        
      18. 
      
        
    18. 
          1
          
          module RSpec
        
      19. 
      
        
    19. 
          
          
            # RSpec::Expectations provides a simple, readable API to express
        
      20. 
      
        
    20. 
          
          
            # the expected outcomes in a code example. To express an expected
        
      21. 
      
        
    21. 
          
          
            # outcome, wrap an object or block in `expect`, call `to` or `to_not`
        
      22. 
      
        
    22. 
          
          
            # (aliased as `not_to`) and pass it a matcher object:
        
      23. 
      
        
    23. 
          
          
            #
        
      24. 
      
        
    24. 
          
          
            #     expect(order.total).to eq(Money.new(5.55, :USD))
        
      25. 
      
        
    25. 
          
          
            #     expect(list).to include(user)
        
      26. 
      
        
    26. 
          
          
            #     expect(message).not_to match(/foo/)
        
      27. 
      
        
    27. 
          
          
            #     expect { do_something }.to raise_error
        
      28. 
      
        
    28. 
          
          
            #
        
      29. 
      
        
    29. 
          
          
            # The last form (the block form) is needed to match against ruby constructs
        
      30. 
      
        
    30. 
          
          
            # that are not objects, but can only be observed when executing a block
        
      31. 
      
        
    31. 
          
          
            # of code. This includes raising errors, throwing symbols, yielding,
        
      32. 
      
        
    32. 
          
          
            # and changing values.
        
      33. 
      
        
    33. 
          
          
            #
        
      34. 
      
        
    34. 
          
          
            # When `expect(...).to` is invoked with a matcher, it turns around
        
      35. 
      
        
    35. 
          
          
            # and calls `matcher.matches?(<object wrapped by expect>)`.  For example,
        
      36. 
      
        
    36. 
          
          
            # in the expression:
        
      37. 
      
        
    37. 
          
          
            #
        
      38. 
      
        
    38. 
          
          
            #     expect(order.total).to eq(Money.new(5.55, :USD))
        
      39. 
      
        
    39. 
          
          
            #
        
      40. 
      
        
    40. 
          
          
            # ...`eq(Money.new(5.55, :USD))` returns a matcher object, and it results
        
      41. 
      
        
    41. 
          
          
            # in the equivalent of `eq.matches?(order.total)`. If `matches?` returns
        
      42. 
      
        
    42. 
          
          
            # `true`, the expectation is met and execution continues. If `false`, then
        
      43. 
      
        
    43. 
          
          
            # the spec fails with the message returned by `eq.failure_message`.
        
      44. 
      
        
    44. 
          
          
            #
        
      45. 
      
        
    45. 
          
          
            # Given the expression:
        
      46. 
      
        
    46. 
          
          
            #
        
      47. 
      
        
    47. 
          
          
            #     expect(order.entries).not_to include(entry)
        
      48. 
      
        
    48. 
          
          
            #
        
      49. 
      
        
    49. 
          
          
            # ...the `not_to` method (also available as `to_not`) invokes the equivalent of
        
      50. 
      
        
    50. 
          
          
            # `include.matches?(order.entries)`, but it interprets `false` as success, and
        
      51. 
      
        
    51. 
          
          
            # `true` as a failure, using the message generated by
        
      52. 
      
        
    52. 
          
          
            # `include.failure_message_when_negated`.
        
      53. 
      
        
    53. 
          
          
            #
        
      54. 
      
        
    54. 
          
          
            # rspec-expectations ships with a standard set of useful matchers, and writing
        
      55. 
      
        
    55. 
          
          
            # your own matchers is quite simple.
        
      56. 
      
        
    56. 
          
          
            #
        
      57. 
      
        
    57. 
          
          
            # See [RSpec::Matchers](../RSpec/Matchers) for more information about the
        
      58. 
      
        
    58. 
          
          
            # built-in matchers that ship with rspec-expectations, and how to write your
        
      59. 
      
        
    59. 
          
          
            # own custom matchers.
        
      60. 
      
        
    60. 
          1
          
            module Expectations
        
      61. 
      
        
    61. 
          
          
              # Exception raised when an expectation fails.
        
      62. 
      
        
    62. 
          
          
              #
        
      63. 
      
        
    63. 
          
          
              # @note We subclass Exception so that in a stub implementation if
        
      64. 
      
        
    64. 
          
          
              # the user sets an expectation, it can't be caught in their
        
      65. 
      
        
    65. 
          
          
              # code by a bare `rescue`.
        
      66. 
      
        
    66. 
          
          
              # @api public
        
      67. 
      
        
    67. 
          1
          
              class ExpectationNotMetError < Exception
        
      68. 
      
        
    68. 
          
          
              end
        
      69. 
      
        
    69. 
          
          
          
        
      70. 
      
        
    70. 
          
          
              # Exception raised from `aggregate_failures` when multiple expectations fail.
        
      71. 
      
        
    71. 
          
          
              #
        
      72. 
      
        
    72. 
          
          
              # @note The constant is defined here but the extensive logic of this class
        
      73. 
      
        
    73. 
          
          
              #   is lazily defined when `FailureAggregator` is autoloaded, since we do
        
      74. 
      
        
    74. 
          
          
              #   not need to waste time defining that functionality unless
        
      75. 
      
        
    75. 
          
          
              #   `aggregate_failures` is used.
        
      76. 
      
        
    76. 
          1
          
              class MultipleExpectationsNotMetError < ExpectationNotMetError
        
      77. 
      
        
    77. 
          
          
              end
        
      78. 
      
        
    78. 
          
          
          
        
      79. 
      
        
    79. 
          1
          
              autoload :FailureAggregator, "rspec/expectations/failure_aggregator"
        
      80. 
      
        
    80. 
          
          
            end
        
      81. 
      
        
    81. 
          
          
          end
        
      82.

    vendor/cache/ruby/2.3.0/gems/rspec-expectations-3.5.0/lib/rspec/expectations/configuration.rb

              # Provides configuration options for rspec-expectations.
        
      6. 
      
        
    6. 
          
          
              # If you are using rspec-core, you can access this via a
        
      7. 
      
        
    7. 
          
          
              # block passed to `RSpec::Core::Configuration#expect_with`.
        
      8. 
      
        
    8. 
          
          
              # Otherwise, you can access it via RSpec::Expectations.configuration.
        
      9.

      10.

      11. 
      
        
    11.

      12.

    14.

    26.

                # Adds `should` and `should_not` to the given classes
        
      91. 
      
        
    91. 
          
          
                # or modules. This can be used to ensure `should` works
        
      92. 
      
        
    92.

      93. 
      
        
    93.

                def add_should_and_should_not_to(*modules)

                    Expectations::Syntax.enable_should(mod)

      103. 
      
        
    103. 
          
          
                # Sets or gets the backtrace formatter. The backtrace formatter should
        
      104. 
      
        
    104. 
          
          
                # implement `#format_backtrace(Array<String>)`. This is used
        
      105. 
      
        
    105. 
          
          
                # to format backtraces of errors handled by the `raise_error`
        
      106. 
      
        
    106. 
          
          
                # matcher.
        
      107. 
      
        
    107. 
          
          
                #
        
      108. 
      
        
    108. 
          
          
                # If you are using rspec-core, rspec-core's backtrace formatting
        
      109. 
      
        
    109. 
          
          
                # will be used (including respecting the presence or absence of
        
      110.

                  def self.format_backtrace(backtrace)

    149. 
          
          
                # Configures whether RSpec will warn about matcher use which will
        
      150. 
      
        
    150. 
          
          
                # potentially cause false positives in tests.
        
      151. 
      
        
    151. 
          
          
                #
        
      152. 
      
        
    152. 
          
          
                # @param [Boolean] boolean
        
      153. 
      
        
    153. 
          1
          
                def warn_about_potential_false_positives=(boolean)
        
      154. 
      
        
    154. 
          
          
                  if boolean
        
      155. 
      
        
    155. 
          
          
                    self.on_potential_false_positives = :warn
        
      156. 
      
        
    156. 
          
          
                  elsif warn_about_potential_false_positives?
        
      157. 
      
        
    157. 
          
          
                    self.on_potential_false_positives = :nothing
        
      158. 
      
        
    158. 
          
          
                  else
        
      159. 
      
        
    159. 
          
          
                    # no-op, handler is something else
        
      160. 
      
        
    160. 
          
          
                  end
        
      161. 
      
        
    161. 
          
          
                end
        
      162. 
      
        
    162. 
          
          
                #
        
      163. 
      
        
    163. 
          
          
                # Configures what RSpec will do about matcher use which will
        
      164. 
      
        
    164. 
          
          
                # potentially cause false positives in tests.
        
      165. 
      
        
    165. 
          
          
                #
        
      166. 
      
        
    166. 
          
          
                # @param [Symbol] behavior can be set to :warn, :raise or :nothing
        
      167. 
      
        
    167. 
          1
          
                def on_potential_false_positives=(behavior)
        
      168. 
      
        
    168. 
          
          
                  unless FALSE_POSITIVE_BEHAVIOURS.key?(behavior)
        
      169. 
      
        
    169. 
          
          
                    raise ArgumentError, "Supported values are: #{FALSE_POSITIVE_BEHAVIOURS.keys}"
        
      170. 
      
        
    170. 
          
          
                  end
        
      171. 
      
        
    171. 
          
          
                  @on_potential_false_positives = behavior
        
      172. 
      
        
    172. 
          
          
                end
        
      173. 
      
        
    173. 
          
          
          
        
      174. 
      
        
    174. 
          
          
                # Indicates what RSpec will do about matcher use which will
        
      175. 
      
        
    175. 
          
          
                # potentially cause false positives in tests, generally you want to
        
      176. 
      
        
    176. 
          
          
                # avoid such scenarios so this defaults to `true`.
        
      177. 
      
        
    177. 
          1
          
                attr_reader :on_potential_false_positives
        
      178. 
      
        
    178. 
          
          
          
        
      179. 
      
        
    179. 
          
          
                # Indicates whether RSpec will warn about matcher use which will
        
      180. 
      
        
    180. 
          
          
                # potentially cause false positives in tests, generally you want to
        
      181. 
      
        
    181. 
          
          
                # avoid such scenarios so this defaults to `true`.
        
      182. 
      
        
    182. 
          1
          
                def warn_about_potential_false_positives?
        
      183. 
      
        
    183. 
          
          
                  on_potential_false_positives == :warn
        
      184. 
      
        
    184. 
          
          
                end
        
      185. 
      
        
    185. 
          
          
          
        
      186. 
      
        
    186. 
          
          
                # @private
        
      187. 
      
        
    187. 
          1
          
                def false_positives_handler
        
      188. 
      
        
    188. 
          
          
                  FALSE_POSITIVE_BEHAVIOURS.fetch(@on_potential_false_positives)
        
      189. 
      
        
    189. 
          
          
                end
        
      190. 
      
        
    190. 
          
          
              end
        
      191. 
      
        
    191. 
          
          
          
        
      192.

              # Wraps the target of an expectation.
        
      4. 
      
        
    4. 
          
          
              #
        
      5. 
      
        
    5. 
          
          
              # @example
        
      6. 
      
        
    6. 
          
          
              #   expect(something)       # => ExpectationTarget wrapping something
        
      7. 
      
        
    7. 
          
          
              #   expect { do_something } # => ExpectationTarget wrapping the block
        
      8. 
      
        
    8. 
          
          
              #
        
      9. 
      
        
    9. 
          
          
              #   # used with `to`
        
      10. 
      
        
    10. 
          
          
              #   expect(actual).to eq(3)
        
      11. 
      
        
    11. 
          
          
              #
        
      12. 
      
        
    12.

      13. 
      
        
    13.

      14. 
      
        
    14. 
          
          
              #
        
      15. 
      
        
    15. 
          
          
              # @note `ExpectationTarget` is not intended to be instantiated
        
      16. 
      
        
    16. 
          
          
              #   directly by users. Use `expect` instead.
        
      17. 
      
        
    17. 
          1
          
              class ExpectationTarget
        
      18. 
      
        
    18. 
          
          
                # @private
        
      19. 
      
        
    19. 
          
          
                # Used as a sentinel value to be able to tell when the user
        
      20. 
      
        
    20. 
          
          
                # did not pass an argument. We can't use `nil` for that because
        
      21. 
      
        
    21. 
          
          
                # `nil` is a valid value to pass.
        
      22. 
      
        
    22. 
          1
          
                UndefinedValue = Module.new

                def enforce_block_expectation(matcher)

    114. 
          
          
          
        
      115.

                  raise ExpectationNotMetError, "You must pass an argument rather than a block to use the provided " \

                def self.check_message(msg)

                def self.modern_matcher_from(matcher)

                  LegacyMatcherAdapter::RSpec2.wrap(matcher) ||

                  LegacyMatcherAdapter::RSpec1.wrap(matcher) || matcher

                def self.with_matcher(handler, matcher, message)

                  check_message(message)

                def self.handle_failure(matcher, message, failure_message_method)
        
      34. 
      
        
    34. 
          
          
                  message = message.call if message.respond_to?(:call)
        
      35. 
      
        
    35. 
          
          
                  message ||= matcher.__send__(failure_message_method)
        
      36. 
      
        
    36. 
          
          
          
        
      37. 
      
        
    37. 
          
          
                  if matcher.respond_to?(:diffable?) && matcher.diffable?
        
      38. 
      
        
    38. 
          
          
                    ::RSpec::Expectations.fail_with message, matcher.expected, matcher.actual
        
      39. 
      
        
    39. 
          
          
                  else

                    ::RSpec::Expectations.fail_with message
        
      41.

              class PositiveExpectationHandler
        
      47. 
      
        
    47. 
          1
          
                def self.handle_matcher(actual, initial_matcher, message=nil, &block)
        
      48. 
      
        
    48. 
          
          
                  ExpectationHelper.with_matcher(self, initial_matcher, message) do |matcher|
        
      49. 
      
        
    49. 
          
          
                    return ::RSpec::Matchers::BuiltIn::PositiveOperatorMatcher.new(actual) unless initial_matcher
        
      50. 
      
        
    50. 
          
          
                    matcher.matches?(actual, &block) || ExpectationHelper.handle_failure(matcher, message, :failure_message)
        
      51. 
      
        
    51. 
          
          
                  end
        
      52. 
      
        
    52. 
          
          
                end
        
      53. 
      
        
    53. 
          
          
          
        
      54. 
      
        
    54. 
          1
          
                def self.verb

              # @private
        
      68. 
      
        
    68. 
          1
          
              class NegativeExpectationHandler
        
      69. 
      
        
    69. 
          1
          
                def self.handle_matcher(actual, initial_matcher, message=nil, &block)
        
      70. 
      
        
    70. 
          
          
                  ExpectationHelper.with_matcher(self, initial_matcher, message) do |matcher|
        
      71. 
      
        
    71. 
          
          
                    return ::RSpec::Matchers::BuiltIn::NegativeOperatorMatcher.new(actual) unless initial_matcher
        
      72. 
      
        
    72. 
          
          
                    does_not_match?(matcher, actual, &block) || ExpectationHelper.handle_failure(matcher, message, :failure_message_when_negated)
        
      73. 
      
        
    73. 
          
          
                  end
        
      74. 
      
        
    74. 
          
          
                end
        
      75. 
      
        
    75. 
          
          
          
        
      76. 
      
        
    76. 
          1
          
                def self.does_not_match?(matcher, actual, &block)
        
      77. 
      
        
    77. 
          
          
                  if matcher.respond_to?(:does_not_match?)
        
      78. 
      
        
    78. 
          
          
                    matcher.does_not_match?(actual, &block)

      81. 
      
        
    81.

              # Wraps a matcher written against one of the legacy protocols in

                  ::RSpec.warn_deprecation(<<-EOS.gsub(/^\s+\|/, ''), :type => "legacy_matcher")
        
      105. 
      
        
    105. 
          
          
                    |#{matcher.class.name || matcher.inspect} implements a legacy RSpec matcher
        
      106. 
      
        
    106. 
          
          
                    |protocol. For the current protocol you should expose the failure messages
        
      107. 
      
        
    107. 
          
          
                    |via the `failure_message` and `failure_message_when_negated` methods.
        
      108.

      116. 
      
        
    116. 
          
          
                # Starting in RSpec 1.2 (and continuing through all 2.x releases),
        
      117. 
      
        
    117.

      118. 
      
        
    118.

      119. 
      
        
    119.

                class RSpec2 < self

          1
          
                  def failure_message

                    base_matcher.failure_message_for_should

    124.

      126.

          1

      127. 
      
        
    127. 
          
          
                    base_matcher.failure_message_for_should_not
        
      128. 
      
        
    128. 
          
          
                  end
        
      129. 
      
        
    129. 
          
          
          
        
      130. 
      
        
    130. 
          1
          
                  def self.interface_matches?(matcher)
        
      131. 
      
        
    131. 
          
          
                    (
        
      132. 
      
        
    132. 
          
          
                      !matcher.respond_to?(:failure_message) &&
        
      133. 
      
        
    133. 
          
          
                      matcher.respond_to?(:failure_message_for_should)
        
      134.

    137.

      138. 
      
        
    138.

      139. 
      
        
    139. 
          
          
                end
        
      140. 
      
        
    140. 
          
          
          
        
      141. 
      
        
    141. 
          
          
                # Before RSpec 1.2, the failure message protocol was:
        
      142. 
      
        
    142. 
          
          
                #   * `failure_message`
        
      143. 
      
        
    143.

      149.

      150.

                  def failure_message_when_negated
        
      151. 
      
        
    151. 
          
          
                    base_matcher.negative_failure_message
        
      152. 
      
        
    152. 
          
          
                  end
        
      153. 
      
        
    153. 
          
          
          
        
      154. 
      
        
    154. 
          
          
                  # Note: `failure_message` is part of the RSpec 3 protocol
        
      155. 
      
        
    155. 
          
          
                  # (paired with `failure_message_when_negated`), so we don't check
        
      156. 
      
        
    156. 
          
          
                  # for `failure_message` here.
        
      157. 
      
        
    157. 
          1
          
                  def self.interface_matches?(matcher)
        
      158. 
      
        
    158. 
          
          
                    !matcher.respond_to?(:failure_message_when_negated) &&
        
      159. 
      
        
    159. 
          
          
                    matcher.respond_to?(:negative_failure_message)
        
      160. 
      
        
    160. 
          
          
                  end
        
      161. 
      
        
    161. 
          
          
                end
        
      162. 
      
        
    162. 
          
          
              end
        
      163. 
      
        
    163. 
          
          
          
        
      164. 
      
        
    164. 
          
          
              # RSpec 3.0 was released with the class name misspelled. For SemVer compatibility,
        
      165.

      166.

            # The legacy `:should` syntax adds the following methods directly to
        
      105. 
      
        
    105. 
          
          
            # `BasicObject` so that they are available off of any object. Note, however,

          1
          
            class BasicObject
        
      109. 
      
        
    109. 
          
          
              # @method should
        
      110. 
      
        
    110. 
          
          
              # Passes if `matcher` returns true.  Available on every `Object`.
        
      111. 
      
        
    111. 
          
          
              # @example
        
      112. 
      
        
    112. 
          
          
              #   actual.should eq expected
        
      113. 
      
        
    113. 
          
          
              #   actual.should match /expression/
        
      114. 
      
        
    114. 
          
          
              # @param [Matcher]
        
      115. 
      
        
    115. 
          
          
              #   matcher
        
      116. 
      
        
    116. 
          
          
              # @param [String] message optional message to display when the expectation fails
        
      117. 
      
        
    117. 
          
          
              # @return [Boolean] true if the expectation succeeds (else raises)
        
      118. 
      
        
    118. 
          
          
              # @note This is only available when you have enabled the `:should` syntax.
        
      119. 
      
        
    119.

      120. 
      
        
    120. 
          
          
          
        
      121. 
      
        
    121. 
          
          
              # @method should_not
        
      122.

              # Passes if `matcher` returns false.  Available on every `Object`.
        
      123. 
      
        
    123. 
          
          
              # @example
        
      124. 
      
        
    124. 
          
          
              #   actual.should_not eq expected
        
      125. 
      
        
    125. 
          
          
              # @param [Matcher]
        
      126. 
      
        
    126. 
          
          
              #   matcher
        
      127. 
      
        
    127. 
          
          
              # @param [String] message optional message to display when the expectation fails
        
      128. 
      
        
    128. 
          
          
              # @return [Boolean] false if the negative expectation succeeds (else raises)
        
      129. 
      
        
    129. 
          
          
              # @note This is only available when you have enabled the `:should` syntax.
        
      130. 
      
        
    130. 
          
          
              # @see RSpec::Matchers
        
      131. 
      
        
    131. 
          
          
            end
        
      132. 
      
        
    132.

      15. 
      
        
    15. 
          
          
          
        
      16. 
      
        
    16. 
          
          
          # RSpec's top level namespace. All of rspec-expectations is contained
        
      17. 
      
        
    17. 
          
          
          # in the `RSpec::Expectations` and `RSpec::Matchers` namespaces.
        
      18. 
      
        
    18. 
          1
          
          module RSpec
        
      19. 
      
        
    19. 
          
          
            # RSpec::Matchers provides a number of useful matchers we use to define
        
      20. 
      
        
    20. 
          
          
            # expectations. Any object that implements the [matcher protocol](Matchers/MatcherProtocol)
        
      21. 
      
        
    21. 
          
          
            # can be used as a matcher.
        
      22. 
      
        
    22. 
          
          
            #
        
      23. 
      
        
    23. 
          
          
            # ## Predicates
        
      24. 
      
        
    24. 
          
          
            #
        
      25. 
      
        
    25. 
          
          
            # In addition to matchers that are defined explicitly, RSpec will create
        
      26. 
      
        
    26. 
          
          
            # custom matchers on the fly for any arbitrary predicate, giving your specs a
        
      27. 
      
        
    27. 
          
          
            # much more natural language feel.
        
      28. 
      
        
    28. 
          
          
            #
        
      29. 
      
        
    29. 
          
          
            # A Ruby predicate is a method that ends with a "?" and returns true or false.
        
      30. 
      
        
    30. 
          
          
            # Common examples are `empty?`, `nil?`, and `instance_of?`.
        
      31.
