              end
        
      38. 
      
        
    38. 
          
          
          
        
      39. 
      
        
    39. 
          
          
              # Represents an individual method stub or message expectation. The methods
        
      40. 
      
        
    40. 
          
          
              # defined here can be used to configure how it behaves. The methods return
        
      41. 
      
        
    41. 
          
          
              # `self` so that they can be chained together to form a fluent interface.
        
      42. 
      
        
    42. 
          1
          
              class MessageExpectation
        
      43. 
      
        
    43. 
          
          
                # @!group Configuring Responses
        
      44. 
      
        
    44. 
          
          
          
        
      45. 
      
        
    45. 
          
          
                # @overload and_return(value)
        
      46. 
      
        
    46. 
          
          
                # @overload and_return(first_value, second_value)
        
      47. 
      
        
    47. 
          
          
                #
        
      48. 
      
        
    48. 
          
          
                # Tells the object to return a value when it receives the message.  Given
        
      49. 
      
        
    49. 
          
          
                # more than one value, the first value is returned the first time the
        
      50. 
      
        
    50. 
          
          
                # message is received, the second value is returned the next time, etc,
        
      51. 
      
        
    51. 
          
          
                # etc.
        
      52. 
      
        
    52. 
          
          
                #
        
      53. 
      
        
    53. 
          
          
                # If the message is received more times than there are values, the last
        
      54. 
      
        
    54. 
          
          
                # value is received for every subsequent call.
        
      55. 
      
        
    55. 
          
          
                #
        
      56. 
      
        
    56. 
          
          
                # @return [nil] No further chaining is supported after this.
        
      57. 
      
        
    57. 
          
          
                # @example
        
      58. 
      
        
    58. 
          
          
                #   allow(counter).to receive(:count).and_return(1)
        
      59. 
      
        
    59. 
          
          
                #   counter.count # => 1
        
      60. 
      
        
    60. 
          
          
                #   counter.count # => 1
        
      61. 
      
        
    61. 
          
          
                #
        
      62. 
      
        
    62. 
          
          
                #   allow(counter).to receive(:count).and_return(1,2,3)
        
      63. 
      
        
    63. 
          
          
                #   counter.count # => 1
        
      64. 
      
        
    64. 
          
          
                #   counter.count # => 2
        
      65. 
      
        
    65. 
          
          
                #   counter.count # => 3
        
      66. 
      
        
    66. 
          
          
                #   counter.count # => 3
        
      67. 
      
        
    67. 
          
          
                #   counter.count # => 3
        
      68. 
      
        
    68. 
          
          
                #   # etc
        
      69. 
      
        
    69. 
          1
          
                def and_return(first_value, *values)
        
      70. 
      
        
    70. 
          
          
                  raise_already_invoked_error_if_necessary(__method__)
        
      71. 
      
        
    71. 
          
          
                  if negative?
        
      72. 
      
        
    72. 
          
          
                    raise "`and_return` is not supported with negative message expectations"
        
      73. 
      
        
    73. 
          
          
                  end
        
      74. 
      
        
    74. 
          
          
          
        
      75. 
      
        
    75. 
          
          
                  if block_given?
        
      76. 
      
        
    76. 
          
          
                    raise ArgumentError, "Implementation blocks aren't supported with `and_return`"
        
      77. 
      
        
    77. 
          
          
                  end
        
      78. 
      
        
    78. 
          
          
          
        
      79. 
      
        
    79. 
          
          
                  values.unshift(first_value)
        
      80. 
      
        
    80. 
          
          
                  @expected_received_count = [@expected_received_count, values.size].max unless ignoring_args? || (@expected_received_count == 0 && @at_least)
        
      81. 
      
        
    81. 
          
          
                  self.terminal_implementation_action = AndReturnImplementation.new(values)
        
      82. 
      
        
    82. 
          
          
          
        
      83. 
      
        
    83. 
          
          
                  nil
        
      84. 
      
        
    84. 
          
          
                end
        
      85. 
      
        
    85. 
          
          
          
        
      86. 
      
        
    86. 
          
          
                # Tells the object to delegate to the original unmodified method
        
      87. 
      
        
    87. 
          
          
                # when it receives the message.
        
      88. 
      
        
    88. 
          
          
                #
        
      89. 
      
        
    89. 
          
          
                # @note This is only available on partial doubles.
        
      90. 
      
        
    90. 
          
          
                #
        
      91. 
      
        
    91. 
          
          
                # @return [nil] No further chaining is supported after this.
        
      92. 
      
        
    92. 
          
          
                # @example
        
      93. 
      
        
    93. 
          
          
                #   expect(counter).to receive(:increment).and_call_original
        
      94. 
      
        
    94. 
          
          
                #   original_count = counter.count
        
      95. 
      
        
    95. 
          
          
                #   counter.increment
        
      96. 
      
        
    96. 
          
          
                #   expect(counter.count).to eq(original_count + 1)
        
      97. 
      
        
    97. 
          1
          
                def and_call_original
        
      98. 
      
        
    98. 
          
          
                  wrap_original(__method__) do |original, *args, &block|
        
      99. 
      
        
    99. 
          
          
                    original.call(*args, &block)
        
      100. 
      
        
    100. 
          
          
                  end
        
      101. 
      
        
    101. 
          
          
                end
        
      102. 
      
        
    102. 
          
          
          
        
      103. 
      
        
    103. 
          
          
                # Decorates the stubbed method with the supplied block. The original
        
      104. 
      
        
    104. 
          
          
                # unmodified method is passed to the block along with any method call
        
      105. 
      
        
    105. 
          
          
                # arguments so you can delegate to it, whilst still being able to
        
      106. 
      
        
    106. 
          
          
                # change what args are passed to it and/or change the return value.
        
      107. 
      
        
    107. 
          
          
                #
        
      108. 
      
        
    108. 
          
          
                # @note This is only available on partial doubles.
        
      109. 
      
        
    109. 
          
          
                #
        
      110. 
      
        
    110. 
          
          
                # @return [nil] No further chaining is supported after this.
        
      111. 
      
        
    111. 
          
          
                # @example
        
      112. 
      
        
    112. 
          
          
                #   expect(api).to receive(:large_list).and_wrap_original do |original_method, *args, &block|
        
      113. 
      
        
    113. 
          
          
                #     original_method.call(*args, &block).first(10)
        
      114. 
      
        
    114. 
          
          
                #   end
        
      115. 
      
        
    115. 
          1
          
                def and_wrap_original(&block)
        
      116. 
      
        
    116. 
          
          
                  wrap_original(__method__, &block)
        
      117. 
      
        
    117. 
          
          
                end
        
      118. 
      
        
    118. 
          
          
          
        
      119. 
      
        
    119. 
          
          
                # @overload and_raise
        
      120. 
      
        
    120. 
          
          
                # @overload and_raise(ExceptionClass)
        
      121. 
      
        
    121. 
          
          
                # @overload and_raise(ExceptionClass, message)
        
      122. 
      
        
    122. 
          
          
                # @overload and_raise(exception_instance)
        
      123. 
      
        
    123. 
          
          
                #
        
      124. 
      
        
    124. 
          
          
                # Tells the object to raise an exception when the message is received.
        
      125. 
      
        
    125. 
          
          
                #
        
      126. 
      
        
    126. 
          
          
                # @return [nil] No further chaining is supported after this.
        
      127. 
      
        
    127. 
          
          
                # @note
        
      128. 
      
        
    128. 
          
          
                #   When you pass an exception class, the MessageExpectation will raise
        
      129. 
      
        
    129. 
          
          
                #   an instance of it, creating it with `exception` and passing `message`
        
      130. 
      
        
    130. 
          
          
                #   if specified.  If the exception class initializer requires more than
        
      131. 
      
        
    131. 
          
          
                #   one parameters, you must pass in an instance and not the class,
        
      132. 
      
        
    132. 
          
          
                #   otherwise this method will raise an ArgumentError exception.
        
      133. 
      
        
    133. 
          
          
                #
        
      134. 
      
        
    134. 
          
          
                # @example
        
      135. 
      
        
    135. 
          
          
                #   allow(car).to receive(:go).and_raise
        
      136. 
      
        
    136. 
          
          
                #   allow(car).to receive(:go).and_raise(OutOfGas)
        
      137. 
      
        
    137. 
          
          
                #   allow(car).to receive(:go).and_raise(OutOfGas, "At least 2 oz of gas needed to drive")
        
      138. 
      
        
    138. 
          
          
                #   allow(car).to receive(:go).and_raise(OutOfGas.new(2, :oz))
        
      139. 
      
        
    139. 
          1
          
                def and_raise(*args)
        
      140. 
      
        
    140. 
          
          
                  raise_already_invoked_error_if_necessary(__method__)
        
      141. 
      
        
    141. 
          
          
                  self.terminal_implementation_action = Proc.new { raise(*args) }
        
      142. 
      
        
    142. 
          
          
                  nil
        
      143. 
      
        
    143. 
          
          
                end
        
      144. 
      
        
    144. 
          
          
          
        
      145. 
      
        
    145. 
          
          
                # @overload and_throw(symbol)
        
      146. 
      
        
    146. 
          
          
                # @overload and_throw(symbol, object)
        
      147. 
      
        
    147. 
          
          
                #
        
      148. 
      
        
    148. 
          
          
                # Tells the object to throw a symbol (with the object if that form is
        
      149. 
      
        
    149. 
          
          
                # used) when the message is received.
        
      150. 
      
        
    150. 
          
          
                #
        
      151. 
      
        
    151. 
          
          
                # @return [nil] No further chaining is supported after this.
        
      152. 
      
        
    152. 
          
          
                # @example
        
      153. 
      
        
    153. 
          
          
                #   allow(car).to receive(:go).and_throw(:out_of_gas)
        
      154. 
      
        
    154. 
          
          
                #   allow(car).to receive(:go).and_throw(:out_of_gas, :level => 0.1)
        
      155. 
      
        
    155. 
          1
          
                def and_throw(*args)
        
      156. 
      
        
    156. 
          
          
                  raise_already_invoked_error_if_necessary(__method__)
        
      157. 
      
        
    157. 
          
          
                  self.terminal_implementation_action = Proc.new { throw(*args) }
        
      158. 
      
        
    158. 
          
          
                  nil
        
      159. 
      
        
    159. 
          
          
                end
        
      160. 
      
        
    160. 
          
          
          
        
      161. 
      
        
    161. 
          
          
                # Tells the object to yield one or more args to a block when the message
        
      162. 
      
        
    162. 
          
          
                # is received.
        
      163. 
      
        
    163. 
          
          
                #
        
      164. 
      
        
    164. 
          
          
                # @return [MessageExpectation] self, to support further chaining.
        
      165. 
      
        
    165. 
          
          
                # @example
        
      166. 
      
        
    166. 
          
          
                #   stream.stub(:open).and_yield(StringIO.new)
        
      167. 
      
        
    167. 
          1
          
                def and_yield(*args, &block)
        
      168. 
      
        
    168. 
          
          
                  raise_already_invoked_error_if_necessary(__method__)
        
      169. 
      
        
    169. 
          
          
                  yield @eval_context = Object.new if block
        
      170. 
      
        
    170. 
          
          
          
        
      171. 
      
        
    171. 
          
          
                  # Initialize args to yield now that it's being used, see also: comment
        
      172. 
      
        
    172. 
          
          
                  # in constructor.
        
      173. 
      
        
    173. 
          
          
                  @args_to_yield ||= []
        
      174. 
      
        
    174. 
          
          
          
        
      175. 
      
        
    175. 
          
          
                  @args_to_yield << args
        
      176. 
      
        
    176. 
          
          
                  self.initial_implementation_action = AndYieldImplementation.new(@args_to_yield, @eval_context, @error_generator)
        
      177. 
      
        
    177. 
          
          
                  self
        
      178. 
      
        
    178. 
          
          
                end
        
      179. 
      
        
    179. 
          
          
                # @!endgroup
        
      180. 
      
        
    180. 
          
          
          
        
      181. 
      
        
    181. 
          
          
                # @!group Constraining Receive Counts
        
      182. 
      
        
    182. 
          
          
          
        
      183. 
      
        
    183. 
          
          
                # Constrain a message expectation to be received a specific number of
        
      184. 
      
        
    184. 
          
          
                # times.
        
      185. 
      
        
    185. 
          
          
                #
        
      186. 
      
        
    186. 
          
          
                # @return [MessageExpectation] self, to support further chaining.
        
      187. 
      
        
    187. 
          
          
                # @example
        
      188. 
      
        
    188. 
          
          
                #   expect(dealer).to receive(:deal_card).exactly(10).times
        
      189. 
      
        
    189. 
          1
          
                def exactly(n, &block)
        
      190. 
      
        
    190. 
          
          
                  raise_already_invoked_error_if_necessary(__method__)
        
      191. 
      
        
    191. 
          
          
                  self.inner_implementation_action = block
        
      192. 
      
        
    192. 
          
          
                  set_expected_received_count :exactly, n
        
      193. 
      
        
    193. 
          
          
                  self
        
      194. 
      
        
    194. 
          
          
                end
        
      195. 
      
        
    195. 
          
          
          
        
      196. 
      
        
    196. 
          
          
                # Constrain a message expectation to be received at least a specific
        
      197. 
      
        
    197. 
          
          
                # number of times.
        
      198. 
      
        
    198. 
          
          
                #
        
      199. 
      
        
    199. 
          
          
                # @return [MessageExpectation] self, to support further chaining.
        
      200. 
      
        
    200. 
          
          
                # @example
        
      201. 
      
        
    201. 
          
          
                #   expect(dealer).to receive(:deal_card).at_least(9).times
        
      202. 
      
        
    202. 
          1
          
                def at_least(n, &block)
        
      203. 
      
        
    203. 
          
          
                  raise_already_invoked_error_if_necessary(__method__)
        
      204. 
      
        
    204. 
          
          
                  set_expected_received_count :at_least, n
        
      205. 
      
        
    205. 
          
          
          
        
      206. 
      
        
    206. 
          
          
                  if n == 0
        
      207. 
      
        
    207. 
          
          
                    raise "at_least(0) has been removed, use allow(...).to receive(:message) instead"
        
      208. 
      
        
    208. 
          
          
                  end
        
      209. 
      
        
    209. 
          
          
          
        
      210. 
      
        
    210. 
          
          
                  self.inner_implementation_action = block
        
      211. 
      
        
    211. 
          
          
          
        
      212. 
      
        
    212. 
          
          
                  self
        
      213. 
      
        
    213. 
          
          
                end
        
      214. 
      
        
    214. 
          
          
          
        
      215. 
      
        
    215. 
          
          
                # Constrain a message expectation to be received at most a specific
        
      216. 
      
        
    216. 
          
          
                # number of times.
        
      217. 
      
        
    217. 
          
          
                #
        
      218. 
      
        
    218. 
          
          
                # @return [MessageExpectation] self, to support further chaining.
        
      219. 
      
        
    219. 
          
          
                # @example
        
      220. 
      
        
    220. 
          
          
                #   expect(dealer).to receive(:deal_card).at_most(10).times
        
      221. 
      
        
    221. 
          1
          
                def at_most(n, &block)
        
      222. 
      
        
    222. 
          
          
                  raise_already_invoked_error_if_necessary(__method__)
        
      223. 
      
        
    223. 
          
          
                  self.inner_implementation_action = block
        
      224. 
      
        
    224. 
          
          
                  set_expected_received_count :at_most, n
        
      225. 
      
        
    225. 
          
          
                  self
        
      226. 
      
        
    226. 
          
          
                end
        
      227. 
      
        
    227. 
          
          
          
        
      228. 
      
        
    228. 
          
          
                # Syntactic sugar for `exactly`, `at_least` and `at_most`
        
      229. 
      
        
    229. 
          
          
                #
        
      230. 
      
        
    230. 
          
          
                # @return [MessageExpectation] self, to support further chaining.
        
      231. 
      
        
    231. 
          
          
                # @example
        
      232. 
      
        
    232. 
          
          
                #   expect(dealer).to receive(:deal_card).exactly(10).times
        
      233. 
      
        
    233. 
          
          
                #   expect(dealer).to receive(:deal_card).at_least(10).times
        
      234. 
      
        
    234. 
          
          
                #   expect(dealer).to receive(:deal_card).at_most(10).times
        
      235. 
      
        
    235. 
          1
          
                def times(&block)
        
      236. 
      
        
    236. 
          
          
                  self.inner_implementation_action = block
        
      237. 
      
        
    237. 
          
          
                  self
        
      238. 
      
        
    238. 
          
          
                end
        
      239. 
      
        
    239. 
          
          
          
        
      240. 
      
        
    240. 
          
          
                # Expect a message not to be received at all.
        
      241. 
      
        
    241. 
          
          
                #
        
      242. 
      
        
    242. 
          
          
                # @return [MessageExpectation] self, to support further chaining.
        
      243. 
      
        
    243. 
          
          
                # @example
        
      244. 
      
        
    244. 
          
          
                #   expect(car).to receive(:stop).never
        
      245. 
      
        
    245. 
          1
          
                def never
        
      246. 
      
        
    246. 
          
          
                  error_generator.raise_double_negation_error("expect(obj)") if negative?
        
      247. 
      
        
    247. 
          
          
                  @expected_received_count = 0
        
      248. 
      
        
    248. 
          
          
                  self
        
      249. 
      
        
    249. 
          
          
                end
        
      250. 
      
        
    250. 
          
          
          
        
      251. 
      
        
    251. 
          
          
                # Expect a message to be received exactly one time.
        
      252. 
      
        
    252. 
          
          
                #
        
      253. 
      
        
    253. 
          
          
                # @return [MessageExpectation] self, to support further chaining.
        
      254. 
      
        
    254. 
          
          
                # @example
        
      255. 
      
        
    255. 
          
          
                #   expect(car).to receive(:go).once
        
      256. 
      
        
    256. 
          1
          
                def once(&block)
        
      257. 
      
        
    257. 
          
          
                  self.inner_implementation_action = block
        
      258. 
      
        
    258. 
          
          
                  set_expected_received_count :exactly, 1
        
      259. 
      
        
    259. 
          
          
                  self
        
      260. 
      
        
    260. 
          
          
                end
        
      261. 
      
        
    261. 
          
          
          
        
      262. 
      
        
    262. 
          
          
                # Expect a message to be received exactly two times.
        
      263. 
      
        
    263. 
          
          
                #
        
      264. 
      
        
    264. 
          
          
                # @return [MessageExpectation] self, to support further chaining.
        
      265. 
      
        
    265. 
          
          
                # @example
        
      266. 
      
        
    266. 
          
          
                #   expect(car).to receive(:go).twice
        
      267. 
      
        
    267. 
          1
          
                def twice(&block)
        
      268. 
      
        
    268. 
          
          
                  self.inner_implementation_action = block
        
      269. 
      
        
    269. 
          
          
                  set_expected_received_count :exactly, 2
        
      270. 
      
        
    270. 
          
          
                  self
        
      271. 
      
        
    271. 
          
          
                end
        
      272. 
      
        
    272. 
          
          
          
        
      273. 
      
        
    273. 
          
          
                # Expect a message to be received exactly three times.
        
      274. 
      
        
    274. 
          
          
                #
        
      275. 
      
        
    275. 
          
          
                # @return [MessageExpectation] self, to support further chaining.
        
      276. 
      
        
    276. 
          
          
                # @example
        
      277. 
      
        
    277. 
          
          
                #   expect(car).to receive(:go).thrice
        
      278. 
      
        
    278. 
          1
          
                def thrice(&block)
        
      279. 
      
        
    279. 
          
          
                  self.inner_implementation_action = block
        
      280. 
      
        
    280. 
          
          
                  set_expected_received_count :exactly, 3
        
      281. 
      
        
    281. 
          
          
                  self
        
      282. 
      
        
    282. 
          
          
                end
        
      283. 
      
        
    283. 
          
          
                # @!endgroup
        
      284. 
      
        
    284. 
          
          
          
        
      285. 
      
        
    285. 
          
          
                # @!group Other Constraints
        
      286. 
      
        
    286. 
          
          
          
        
      287. 
      
        
    287. 
          
          
                # Constrains a stub or message expectation to invocations with specific
        
      288. 
      
        
    288. 
          
          
                # arguments.
        
      289. 
      
        
    289. 
          
          
                #
        
      290. 
      
        
    290. 
          
          
                # With a stub, if the message might be received with other args as well,
        
      291. 
      
        
    291. 
          
          
                # you should stub a default value first, and then stub or mock the same
        
      292. 
      
        
    292. 
          
          
                # message using `with` to constrain to specific arguments.
        
      293. 
      
        
    293. 
          
          
                #
        
      294. 
      
        
    294. 
          
          
                # A message expectation will fail if the message is received with different
        
      295. 
      
        
    295. 
          
          
                # arguments.
        
      296. 
      
        
    296. 
          
          
                #
        
      297. 
      
        
    297. 
          
          
                # @return [MessageExpectation] self, to support further chaining.
        
      298. 
      
        
    298. 
          
          
                # @example
        
      299. 
      
        
    299. 
          
          
                #   allow(cart).to receive(:add) { :failure }
        
      300. 
      
        
    300. 
          
          
                #   allow(cart).to receive(:add).with(Book.new(:isbn => 1934356379)) { :success }
        
      301. 
      
        
    301. 
          
          
                #   cart.add(Book.new(:isbn => 1234567890))
        
      302. 
      
        
    302. 
          
          
                #   # => :failure
        
      303. 
      
        
    303. 
          
          
                #   cart.add(Book.new(:isbn => 1934356379))
        
      304. 
      
        
    304. 
          
          
                #   # => :success
        
      305. 
      
        
    305. 
          
          
                #
        
      306. 
      
        
    306. 
          
          
                #   expect(cart).to receive(:add).with(Book.new(:isbn => 1934356379)) { :success }
        
      307. 
      
        
    307. 
          
          
                #   cart.add(Book.new(:isbn => 1234567890))
        
      308. 
      
        
    308. 
          
          
                #   # => failed expectation
        
      309. 
      
        
    309. 
          
          
                #   cart.add(Book.new(:isbn => 1934356379))
        
      310. 
      
        
    310. 
          
          
                #   # => passes
        
      311. 
      
        
    311. 
          1
          
                def with(*args, &block)
        
      312. 
      
        
    312. 
          
          
                  raise_already_invoked_error_if_necessary(__method__)
        
      313. 
      
        
    313. 
          
          
                  if args.empty?
        
      314. 
      
        
    314. 
          
          
                    raise ArgumentError,
        
      315. 
      
        
    315. 
          
          
                          "`with` must have at least one argument. Use `no_args` matcher to set the expectation of receiving no arguments."
        
      316. 
      
        
    316. 
          
          
                  end
        
      317. 
      
        
    317. 
          
          
          
        
      318. 
      
        
    318. 
          
          
                  self.inner_implementation_action = block
        
      319. 
      
        
    319. 
          
          
                  @argument_list_matcher = ArgumentListMatcher.new(*args)
        
      320. 
      
        
    320. 
          
          
                  self
        
      321. 
      
        
    321. 
          
          
                end
        
      322. 
      
        
    322. 
          
          
          
        
      323. 
      
        
    323. 
          
          
                # Expect messages to be received in a specific order.
        
      324. 
      
        
    324. 
          
          
                #
        
      325. 
      
        
    325. 
          
          
                # @return [MessageExpectation] self, to support further chaining.
        
      326. 
      
        
    326. 
          
          
                # @example
        
      327. 
      
        
    327. 
          
          
                #   expect(api).to receive(:prepare).ordered
        
      328. 
      
        
    328. 
          
          
                #   expect(api).to receive(:run).ordered
        
      329. 
      
        
    329. 
          
          
                #   expect(api).to receive(:finish).ordered
        
      330. 
      
        
    330. 
          1
          
                def ordered(&block)
        
      331. 
      
        
    331. 
          
          
                  if type == :stub
        
      332. 
      
        
    332. 
          
          
                    RSpec.warning(
        
      333. 
      
        
    333. 
          
          
                      "`allow(...).to receive(..).ordered` is not supported and will" \
        
      334. 
      
        
    334. 
          
          
                      "have no effect, use `and_return(*ordered_values)` instead."
        
      335. 
      
        
    335. 
          
          
                    )
        
      336. 
      
        
    336. 
          
          
                  end
        
      337. 
      
        
    337. 
          
          
          
        
      338. 
      
        
    338. 
          
          
                  self.inner_implementation_action = block
        
      339. 
      
        
    339. 
          
          
                  additional_expected_calls.times do
        
      340. 
      
        
    340. 
          
          
                    @order_group.register(self)
        
      341. 
      
        
    341. 
          
          
                  end
        
      342. 
      
        
    342. 
          
          
                  @ordered = true
        
      343. 
      
        
    343. 
          
          
                  self
        
      344. 
      
        
    344. 
          
          
                end
        
      345. 
      
        
    345. 
          
          
          
        
      346. 
      
        
    346. 
          
          
                # @return [String] a nice representation of the message expectation
        
      347. 
      
        
    347. 
          1
          
                def to_s
        
      348. 
      
        
    348. 
          
          
                  args_description = error_generator.method_call_args_description(@argument_list_matcher.expected_args, "", "") { true }
        
      349. 
      
        
    349. 
          
          
                  args_description = "(#{args_description})" unless args_description.start_with?("(")
        
      350. 
      
        
    350. 
          
          
                  "#<#{self.class} #{error_generator.intro}.#{message}#{args_description}>"
        
      351. 
      
        
    351. 
          
          
                end
        
      352. 
      
        
    352. 
          1
          
                alias inspect to_s
        
      353. 
      
        
    353. 
          
          
          
        
      354. 
      
        
    354. 
          
          
                # @private
        
      355. 
      
        
    355. 
          
          
                # Contains the parts of `MessageExpectation` that aren't part of
        
      356. 
      
        
    356. 
          
          
                # rspec-mocks' public API. The class is very big and could really use
        
      357. 
      
        
    357. 
          
          
                # some collaborators it delegates to for this stuff but for now this was
        
      358. 
      
        
    358. 
          
          
                # the simplest way to split the public from private stuff to make it
        
      359. 
      
        
    359. 
          
          
                # easier to publish the docs for the APIs we want published.
        
      360. 
      
        
    360. 
          1
          
                module ImplementationDetails
        
      361. 
      
        
    361. 
          1
          
                  attr_accessor :error_generator, :implementation
        
      362. 
      
        
    362. 
          1
          
                  attr_reader :message
        
      363. 
      
        
    363. 
          1
          
                  attr_reader :orig_object
        
      364. 
      
        
    364. 
          1
          
                  attr_writer :expected_received_count, :expected_from, :argument_list_matcher
        
      365. 
      
        
    365. 
          1
          
                  protected :expected_received_count=, :expected_from=, :error_generator, :error_generator=, :implementation=
        
      366. 
      
        
    366. 
          
          
          
        
      367. 
      
        
    367. 
          
          
                  # @private
        
      368. 
      
        
    368. 
          1
          
                  attr_reader :type
        
      369. 
      
        
    369. 
          
          
          
        
      370. 
      
        
    370. 
          
          
                  # rubocop:disable Style/ParameterLists
        
      371. 
      
        
    371. 
          1
          
                  def initialize(error_generator, expectation_ordering, expected_from, method_double,
        
      372. 
      
        
    372. 
          
          
                                 type=:expectation, opts={}, &implementation_block)
        
      373. 
      
        
    373. 
          
          
                    @type = type
        
      374. 
      
        
    374. 
          
          
                    @error_generator = error_generator
        
      375. 
      
        
    375. 
          
          
                    @error_generator.opts = opts
        
      376. 
      
        
    376. 
          
          
                    @expected_from = expected_from
        
      377. 
      
        
    377. 
          
          
                    @method_double = method_double
        
      378. 
      
        
    378. 
          
          
                    @orig_object = @method_double.object
        
      379. 
      
        
    379. 
          
          
                    @message = @method_double.method_name
        
      380. 
      
        
    380. 
          
          
                    @actual_received_count = 0
        
      381. 
      
        
    381. 
          
          
                    @expected_received_count = type == :expectation ? 1 : :any
        
      382. 
      
        
    382. 
          
          
                    @argument_list_matcher = ArgumentListMatcher::MATCH_ALL
        
      383. 
      
        
    383. 
          
          
                    @order_group = expectation_ordering
        
      384. 
      
        
    384. 
          
          
                    @order_group.register(self) unless type == :stub
        
      385. 
      
        
    385. 
          
          
                    @expectation_type = type
        
      386. 
      
        
    386. 
          
          
                    @ordered = false
        
      387. 
      
        
    387. 
          
          
                    @at_least = @at_most = @exactly = nil
        
      388. 
      
        
    388. 
          
          
          
        
      389. 
      
        
    389. 
          
          
                    # Initialized to nil so that we don't allocate an array for every
        
      390. 
      
        
    390. 
          
          
                    # mock or stub. See also comment in `and_yield`.
        
      391. 
      
        
    391. 
          
          
                    @args_to_yield = nil
        
      392. 
      
        
    392. 
          
          
                    @eval_context = nil
        
      393. 
      
        
    393. 
          
          
                    @yield_receiver_to_implementation_block = false
        
      394. 
      
        
    394. 
          
          
          
        
      395. 
      
        
    395. 
          
          
                    @implementation = Implementation.new
        
      396. 
      
        
    396. 
          
          
                    self.inner_implementation_action = implementation_block
        
      397. 
      
        
    397. 
          
          
                  end
        
      398. 
      
        
    398. 
          
          
                  # rubocop:enable Style/ParameterLists
        
      399. 
      
        
    399. 
          
          
          
        
      400. 
      
        
    400. 
          1
          
                  def expected_args
        
      401. 
      
        
    401. 
          
          
                    @argument_list_matcher.expected_args
        
      402. 
      
        
    402. 
          
          
                  end
        
      403. 
      
        
    403. 
          
          
          
        
      404. 
      
        
    404. 
          1
          
                  def and_yield_receiver_to_implementation
        
      405. 
      
        
    405. 
          
          
                    @yield_receiver_to_implementation_block = true
        
      406. 
      
        
    406. 
          
          
                    self
        
      407. 
      
        
    407. 
          
          
                  end
        
      408. 
      
        
    408. 
          
          
          
        
      409. 
      
        
    409. 
          1
          
                  def yield_receiver_to_implementation_block?
        
      410. 
      
        
    410. 
          
          
                    @yield_receiver_to_implementation_block
        
      411. 
      
        
    411. 
          
          
                  end
        
      412. 
      
        
    412. 
          
          
          
        
      413. 
      
        
    413. 
          1
          
                  def matches?(message, *args)
        
      414. 
      
        
    414. 
          
          
                    @message == message && @argument_list_matcher.args_match?(*args)
        
      415. 
      
        
    415. 
          
          
                  end
        
      416. 
      
        
    416. 
          
          
          
        
      417. 
      
        
    417. 
          1
          
                  def safe_invoke(parent_stub, *args, &block)
        
      418. 
      
        
    418. 
          
          
                    invoke_incrementing_actual_calls_by(1, false, parent_stub, *args, &block)
        
      419. 
      
        
    419. 
          
          
                  end
        
      420. 
      
        
    420. 
          
          
          
        
      421. 
      
        
    421. 
          1
          
                  def invoke(parent_stub, *args, &block)
        
      422. 
      
        
    422. 
          
          
                    invoke_incrementing_actual_calls_by(1, true, parent_stub, *args, &block)
        
      423. 
      
        
    423. 
          
          
                  end
        
      424. 
      
        
    424. 
          
          
          
        
      425. 
      
        
    425. 
          1
          
                  def invoke_without_incrementing_received_count(parent_stub, *args, &block)
        
      426. 
      
        
    426. 
          
          
                    invoke_incrementing_actual_calls_by(0, true, parent_stub, *args, &block)
        
      427. 
      
        
    427. 
          
          
                  end
        
      428. 
      
        
    428. 
          
          
          
        
      429. 
      
        
    429. 
          1
          
                  def negative?
        
      430. 
      
        
    430. 
          
          
                    @expected_received_count == 0 && !@at_least
        
      431. 
      
        
    431. 
          
          
                  end
        
      432. 
      
        
    432. 
          
          
          
        
      433. 
      
        
    433. 
          1
          
                  def called_max_times?
        
      434. 
      
        
    434. 
          
          
                    @expected_received_count != :any &&
        
      435. 
      
        
    435. 
          
          
                      !@at_least &&
        
      436. 
      
        
    436. 
          
          
                      @expected_received_count > 0 &&
        
      437. 
      
        
    437. 
          
          
                      @actual_received_count >= @expected_received_count
        
      438. 
      
        
    438. 
          
          
                  end
        
      439. 
      
        
    439. 
          
          
          
        
      440. 
      
        
    440. 
          1
          
                  def matches_name_but_not_args(message, *args)
        
      441. 
      
        
    441. 
          
          
                    @message == message && !@argument_list_matcher.args_match?(*args)
        
      442. 
      
        
    442. 
          
          
                  end
        
      443. 
      
        
    443. 
          
          
          
        
      444. 
      
        
    444. 
          1
          
                  def verify_messages_received
        
      445. 
      
        
    445. 
          
          
                    return if expected_messages_received?
        
      446. 
      
        
    446. 
          
          
                    generate_error
        
      447. 
      
        
    447. 
          
          
                  end
        
      448. 
      
        
    448. 
          
          
          
        
      449. 
      
        
    449. 
          1
          
                  def expected_messages_received?
        
      450. 
      
        
    450. 
          
          
                    ignoring_args? || matches_exact_count? || matches_at_least_count? || matches_at_most_count?
        
      451. 
      
        
    451. 
          
          
                  end
        
      452. 
      
        
    452. 
          
          
          
        
      453. 
      
        
    453. 
          1
          
                  def ensure_expected_ordering_received!
        
      454. 
      
        
    454. 
          
          
                    @order_group.verify_invocation_order(self) if @ordered
        
      455. 
      
        
    455. 
          
          
                    true
        
      456. 
      
        
    456. 
          
          
                  end
        
      457. 
      
        
    457. 
          
          
          
        
      458. 
      
        
    458. 
          1
          
                  def ignoring_args?
        
      459. 
      
        
    459. 
          
          
                    @expected_received_count == :any
        
      460. 
      
        
    460. 
          
          
                  end
        
      461. 
      
        
    461. 
          
          
          
        
      462. 
      
        
    462. 
          1
          
                  def matches_at_least_count?
        
      463. 
      
        
    463. 
          
          
                    @at_least && @actual_received_count >= @expected_received_count
        
      464. 
      
        
    464. 
          
          
                  end
        
      465. 
      
        
    465. 
          
          
          
        
      466. 
      
        
    466. 
          1
          
                  def matches_at_most_count?
        
      467. 
      
        
    467. 
          
          
                    @at_most && @actual_received_count <= @expected_received_count
        
      468. 
      
        
    468. 
          
          
                  end
        
      469. 
      
        
    469. 
          
          
          
        
      470. 
      
        
    470. 
          1
          
                  def matches_exact_count?
        
      471. 
      
        
    471. 
          
          
                    @expected_received_count == @actual_received_count
        
      472. 
      
        
    472. 
          
          
                  end
        
      473. 
      
        
    473. 
          
          
          
        
      474. 
      
        
    474. 
          1
          
                  def similar_messages
        
      475. 
      
        
    475. 
          
          
                    @similar_messages ||= []
        
      476. 
      
        
    476. 
          
          
                  end
        
      477. 
      
        
    477. 
          
          
          
        
      478. 
      
        
    478. 
          1
          
                  def advise(*args)
        
      479. 
      
        
    479. 
          
          
                    similar_messages << args
        
      480. 
      
        
    480. 
          
          
                  end
        
      481. 
      
        
    481. 
          
          
          
        
      482. 
      
        
    482. 
          1
          
                  def unadvise(args)

                    similar_messages.delete_if { |message| args.include?(message) }

      485.

      486.

                  def generate_error

                    if similar_messages.empty?
        
      488.

                      @error_generator.raise_expectation_error(

                        @message, @expected_received_count, @argument_list_matcher,
        
      490.

                  def invoke_incrementing_actual_calls_by(increment, allowed_to_fail, parent_stub, *args, &block)
        
      549. 
      
        
    549. 
          
          
                    args.unshift(orig_object) if yield_receiver_to_implementation_block?
        
      550. 
      
        
    550. 
          
          
          
        
      551. 
      
        
    551. 
          
          
                    if negative? || (allowed_to_fail && (@exactly || @at_most) && (@actual_received_count == @expected_received_count))
        
      552. 
      
        
    552. 
          
          
                      # args are the args we actually received, @argument_list_matcher is the
        
      553. 
      
        
    553. 
          
          
                      # list of args we were expecting
        
      554. 
      
        
    554. 
          
          
                      @error_generator.raise_expectation_error(
        
      555. 
      
        
    555. 
          
          
                        @message, @expected_received_count,
        
      556.

      557. 
      
        
    557. 
          
          
                        @actual_received_count + increment,
        
      558. 
      
        
    558. 
          
          
                        expectation_count_type, args, nil, exception_source_id
        
      559. 
      
        
    559. 
          
          
                      )
        
      560. 
      
        
    560. 
          
          
                    end
        
      561. 
      
        
    561. 
          
          
          
        
      562. 
      
        
    562. 
          
          
                    @order_group.handle_order_constraint self
        
      563. 
      
        
    563. 
          
          
          
        
      564.

                    if implementation.present?
        
      565. 
      
        
    565. 
          
          
                      implementation.call(*args, &block)
        
      566. 
      
        
    566. 
          
          
                    elsif parent_stub
        
      567. 
      
        
    567. 
          
          
                      parent_stub.invoke(nil, *args, &block)
        
      568. 
      
        
    568. 
          
          
                    end
        
      569. 
      
        
    569. 
          
          
                  ensure
        
      570. 
      
        
    570. 
          
          
                    @actual_received_count += increment
        
      571. 
      
        
    571. 
          
          
                  end
        
      572. 
      
        
    572. 
          
          
          
        
      573. 
      
        
    573.

                    @actual_received_count > 0

                  def set_expected_received_count(relativity, n)
        
      584. 
      
        
    584. 
          
          
                    @at_least = (relativity == :at_least)
        
      585. 
      
        
    585. 
          
          
                    @at_most  = (relativity == :at_most)
        
      586. 
      
        
    586. 
          
          
                    @exactly  = (relativity == :exactly)
        
      587. 
      
        
    587. 
          
          
                    @expected_received_count = case n
        
      588. 
      
        
    588. 
          
          
                                               when Numeric then n
        
      589. 
      
        
    589. 
          
          
                                               when :once   then 1
        
      590. 
      
        
    590. 
          
          
                                               when :twice  then 2
        
      591.

                                               when :thrice then 3

                  def inner_implementation_action=(action)

                      "You're overriding a previous stub implementation of `#{@message}`. " \

      613.

                  end

                  def wrap_original(method_name, &block)
        
      617. 
      
        
    617. 
          
          
                    if RSpec::Mocks::TestDouble === @method_double.object
        
      618. 
      
        
    618.

      619. 
      
        
    619.

      620. 
      
        
    620. 
          
          
                      warn_about_stub_override if implementation.inner_action
        
      621. 
      
        
    621. 
          
          
                      @implementation = AndWrapOriginalImplementation.new(@method_double.original_implementation_callable, block)
        
      622. 
      
        
    622. 
          
          
                      @yield_receiver_to_implementation_block = false
        
      623.

              # Handles the implementation of an `and_yield` declaration.
        
      633. 
      
        
    633. 
          
          
              # @private
        
      634. 
      
        
    634. 
          1
          
              class AndYieldImplementation
        
      635. 
      
        
    635. 
          1
          
                def initialize(args_to_yield, eval_context, error_generator)
        
      636. 
      
        
    636. 
          
          
                  @args_to_yield = args_to_yield
        
      637. 
      
        
    637. 
          
          
                  @eval_context = eval_context
        
      638. 
      
        
    638. 
          
          
                  @error_generator = error_generator
        
      639. 
      
        
    639. 
          
          
                end
        
      640. 
      
        
    640. 
          
          
          
        
      641. 
      
        
    641. 
          1
          
                def call(*_args_to_ignore, &block)
        
      642. 
      
        
    642. 
          
          
                  return if @args_to_yield.empty? && @eval_context.nil?
        
      643. 
      
        
    643. 
          
          
          
        
      644. 
      
        
    644. 
          
          
                  @error_generator.raise_missing_block_error @args_to_yield unless block
        
      645. 
      
        
    645. 
          
          
                  value = nil
        
      646. 
      
        
    646. 
          
          
                  block_signature = Support::BlockSignature.new(block)
        
      647. 
      
        
    647. 
          
          
          
        
      648. 
      
        
    648. 
          
          
                  @args_to_yield.each do |args|
        
      649. 
      
        
    649. 
          
          
                    unless Support::StrictSignatureVerifier.new(block_signature, args).valid?
        
      650. 
      
        
    650. 
          
          
                      @error_generator.raise_wrong_arity_error(args, block_signature)
        
      651. 
      
        
    651. 
          
          
                    end
        
      652. 
      
        
    652. 
          
          
          
        
      653. 
      
        
    653. 
          
          
                    value = @eval_context ? @eval_context.instance_exec(*args, &block) : block.call(*args)
        
      654. 
      
        
    654. 
          
          
                  end
        
      655. 
      
        
    655. 
          
          
                  value
        
      656. 
      
        
    656. 
          
          
                end
        
      657. 
      
        
    657. 
          
          
              end
        
      658. 
      
        
    658. 
          
          
          
        
      659.

              # Handles the implementation of an `and_return` implementation.

      665.

              # Represents a configured implementation. Takes into account
        
      676. 
      
        
    676. 
          
          
              # any number of sub-implementations.
        
      677. 
      
        
    677. 
          
          
              # @private
        
      678. 
      
        
    678. 
          1
          
              class Implementation
        
      679. 
      
        
    679. 
          1
          
                attr_accessor :initial_action, :inner_action, :terminal_action
        
      680. 
      
        
    680. 
          
          
          
        
      681. 
      
        
    681. 
          1
          
                def call(*args, &block)
        
      682. 
      
        
    682. 
          
          
                  actions.map do |action|
        
      683. 
      
        
    683. 
          
          
                    action.call(*args, &block)
        
      684. 
      
        
    684. 
          
          
                  end.last
        
      685. 
      
        
    685. 
          
          
                end
        
      686. 
      
        
    686. 
          
          
          
        
      687. 
      
        
    687. 
          1
          
                def present?
        
      688. 
      
        
    688. 
          
          
                  actions.any?
        
      689. 
      
        
    689. 
          
          
                end
        
      690.

      691.

          1

      692. 
      
        
    692. 
          
          
          
        
      693.

          1
          
                def actions
        
      694. 
      
        
    694. 
          
          
                  [initial_action, inner_action, terminal_action].compact

    695.

      696. 
      
        
    696. 
          
          
              end
        
      697.

              # Represents an `and_call_original` implementation.
        
      699. 
      
        
    699. 
          
          
              # @private
        
      700. 
      
        
    700. 
          1
          
              class AndWrapOriginalImplementation
        
      701. 
      
        
    701. 
          1
          
                def initialize(method, block)
        
      702. 
      
        
    702. 
          
          
                  @method = method
        
      703. 
      
        
    703. 
          
          
                  @block = block
        
      704. 
      
        
    704. 
          
          
                end
        
      705. 
      
        
    705. 
          
          
          
        
      706. 
      
        
    706. 
          1
          
                CannotModifyFurtherError = Class.new(StandardError)
        
      707. 
      
        
    707. 
          
          
          
        
      708. 
      
        
    708. 
          1
          
                def initial_action=(_value)
        
      709. 
      
        
    709. 
          
          
                  raise cannot_modify_further_error
        
      710. 
      
        
    710. 
          
          
                end
        
      711. 
      
        
    711. 
          
          
          
        
      712. 
      
        
    712. 
          1
          
                def inner_action=(_value)
        
      713. 
      
        
    713. 
          
          
                  raise cannot_modify_further_error
        
      714. 
      
        
    714. 
          
          
                end
        
      715. 
      
        
    715. 
          
          
          
        
      716. 
      
        
    716. 
          1
          
                def terminal_action=(_value)
        
      717. 
      
        
    717. 
          
          
                  raise cannot_modify_further_error
        
      718. 
      
        
    718. 
          
          
                end
        
      719. 
      
        
    719. 
          
          
          
        
      720. 
      
        
    720. 
          1
          
                def present?
        
      721. 
      
        
    721. 
          
          
                  true
        
      722. 
      
        
    722. 
          
          
                end
        
      723. 
      
        
    723. 
          
          
          
        
      724. 
      
        
    724. 
          1
          
                def inner_action
        
      725. 
      
        
    725. 
          
          
                  true
        
      726. 
      
        
    726. 
          
          
                end
        
      727. 
      
        
    727. 
          
          
          
        
      728. 
      
        
    728. 
          1
          
                def call(*args, &block)
        
      729. 
      
        
    729. 
          
          
                  @block.call(@method, *args, &block)
        
      730. 
      
        
    730. 
          
          
                end
        
      731. 
      
        
    731. 
          
          
          
        
      732. 
      
        
    732. 
          1
          
              private
        
      733. 
      
        
    733. 
          
          
          
        
      734. 
      
        
    734. 
          1
          
                def cannot_modify_further_error
        
      735. 
      
        
    735. 
          
          
                  CannotModifyFurtherError.new "This method has already been configured " \
        
      736. 
      
        
    736. 
          
          
                    "to call the original implementation, and cannot be modified further."
        
      737. 
      
        
    737. 
          
          
                end
        
      738. 
      
        
    738. 
          
          
              end
        
      739. 
      
        
    739. 
          
          
            end
        
      740. 
      
        
    740. 
          
          
          end
        
      741.

                # @private

                def initialize(object, method_name, proxy)

                  @method_name = method_name

                  @object = object

                  @proxy = proxy
